CVE-2008-0003.title: OpenPegasus Stack Overflow in PAM Authentication Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0003.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenPegasus. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow in the PAM authentication code and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.The vulnerability resides in PAMBasicAuthenticator::PAMCallback().
CVE-2008-0003.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

CVE-2008-0005.title: Apache Input Validation Hole in mod_proxy_ftp Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0005.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache mod_proxy_ftp. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The mod_proxy_ftp module does not properly filter HTML code from UTF-7 character set user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Apache software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.sp3x of SecurityReason reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://securityreason.com/achievement_securityalert/49
CVE-2008-0005.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Apache software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0006.title: X Server Bugs in XFree86, Xinput, TOG-CUP, MIT-SHM, and EVI Extensions Let Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2008-0006.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in X. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system. A local user can determine whether certain files or directories exist on the target system.A local user can exploit any of several memory corruption errors in the X server to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the target X server (typically root level privileges).A local user can supply a specially PassMessage request to cause an out-of-bounds array index error and trigger a pointer dereference in the XFree86 Misc extension [CVE-2007-5760].A local user can supply a certain type of command ('X :1 -sp <file>') specifying an arbitrary file or directory to identify whether the specified file exists in access-restricted directories based on the error message returned by the system [CVE-2007-5958].A local user can trigger a heap corruption error in the Xinput extension [CVE-2007-6427].A local user can read arbitrary memory contents by exploiting the ProcGetReservedColormapEntries() function in the TOG-CUP extension [CVE-2007-6428].A local user can supply a specially crafted request to trigger an integer overflow in the pixmap creation process in the MIT-SHM and EVI extensions [CVE-2007-6429].A local user can supply a specially crafted PCF font to trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2008-0006].regenrecht reported CVE-2007-5760, CVE-2007-6427, CVE-2007-6428, and CVE-2007-6429 via iDefense. Takuya Shiozaki of CodeBlog reported CVE-2008-0006. An anonymous researcher reported CVE-2007-5859.
CVE-2008-0006.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user can determine whether files or directories exist on the target system.

CVE-2008-0007.title: Linux Kernel Drivers Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2008-0007.body: A vulnerability was reported in Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.Certain drivers that register a fault handler do not properly validate user-supplied arguments. A local user may be able to read or write to arbitrary kernel memory locations.
CVE-2008-0007.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0011.title: Microsoft DirectX MJPEG Stream Error Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0011.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft DirectX in the processing of MJPEG streams. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted MJPEG video stream embedded in an ASF or AVI media file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Mark Dowd of IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0011.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0015.title: Microsoft DirectShow Buffer Overflow in ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0015.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft DirectShow. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the Microsoft Video ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow in 'msvidctl.dll' to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CSLID of the affected control is: 0955AC62-BF2E-4CBA-A2B9-A63F772D46CFThis vulnerability is being actively exploited.Exploit code is publicly available.Windows Vista, Windows Server 2008, and Windows 2000 SP4 are not affected.The vendor was notified in Spring [northern hemisphere] 2008 by Ryan Smith and Alex Wheeler with IBM ISS X-Force.
CVE-2008-0015.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0016.title: Mozilla Firefox Stack Overflow in Parsing UTF-8 URLs Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0016.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a URL with specially crafted UTF-8 characters that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.SeaMonkey is also affected.Justin Schuh and Tom Cross of the IBM X-Force and Peter Williams of IBM Watson Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0016.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0017.title: Mozilla Firefox http-index-format MIME Parsing Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0017.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote server can return a specially crafted HTTP 200 index header response to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.SeaMonkey is also affected.Justin Schuh of the IBM X-Force reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0017.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0020.title: Microsoft Active Template Library (ATL) Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0020.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Active Template Library (ATL). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. Several products and components that use ATL are affected.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an error in the Load method of the IPersistStreamInit interface to invoke a memcopy with user-supplied data, causing arbitrary code to be executed [CVE-2008-0020]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Robert Freeman of IBM ISS X-Force reported this vulnerability.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory free error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2009-2494]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Ryan Smith of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.Affected components include Microsoft Outlook Express, Windows Media Player, the DHTML Editing Component ActiveX Control, the Microsoft MSWebDVD ActiveX Control, and the Windows ATL Component.
CVE-2008-0020.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0026.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2008-0026.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands.The admin and user interface pages do not properly validate user-supplied input in the key parameter. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.This can be exploited to obtain information such as usernames, password hashes, and call records from the database.Cisco CallManager or Unified Communication Manager systems prior to 5.0 are not affected.Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCsk64286 to this vulnerability.Nico Leidecker and Tracey Parry at Portcullis Computer Security Limited reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.portcullis.co.uk/267.php
CVE-2008-0026.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2008-0027.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Buffer Overflow in Certificate Trust List Provider Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0027.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap overflow in the Certificate Trust List Provider service on TCP port 2444 and execute arbitrary code on the target system.Versions 3.3, 5.0, 5.1, 6.0, and 6.1 are not affected. Cisco CallManager Express is not affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj22605 to this vulnerability.TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0027.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0031.title: QuickTime Movie and PICT File Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0031.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted movie file or PICT image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Sorenson 3 video file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0031]. Joe Schottman of Virginia Tech reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Macintosh resource records in movie files can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0032]. Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Image Descriptor (IDSC) atoms can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0033]. Cody Pierce of TippingPoint DVLabs reported this vulnerability.A specally crafted compressed PICT file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0036]. Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0031.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0032.title: QuickTime Movie and PICT File Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0032.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted movie file or PICT image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Sorenson 3 video file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0031]. Joe Schottman of Virginia Tech reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Macintosh resource records in movie files can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0032]. Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Image Descriptor (IDSC) atoms can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0033]. Cody Pierce of TippingPoint DVLabs reported this vulnerability.A specally crafted compressed PICT file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0036]. Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0032.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0033.title: QuickTime Movie and PICT File Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0033.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted movie file or PICT image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Sorenson 3 video file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0031]. Joe Schottman of Virginia Tech reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Macintosh resource records in movie files can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0032]. Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Image Descriptor (IDSC) atoms can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0033]. Cody Pierce of TippingPoint DVLabs reported this vulnerability.A specally crafted compressed PICT file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0036]. Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0033.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0035.title: Apple iPhone URL Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0035.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple iPhone. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.
CVE-2008-0035.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0036.title: QuickTime Movie and PICT File Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0036.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted movie file or PICT image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Sorenson 3 video file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0031]. Joe Schottman of Virginia Tech reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Macintosh resource records in movie files can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0032]. Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted Image Descriptor (IDSC) atoms can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0033]. Cody Pierce of TippingPoint DVLabs reported this vulnerability.A specally crafted compressed PICT file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0036]. Chris Ries of Carnegie Mellon University Computing Services reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0036.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0037.title: Mac OS X X11 Ignores Remote Network Connection Security Preferences Setting
CVE-2008-0037.body: A vulnerability was reported in X11 on Mac OS X. A remote user may be able to connect to the X11 server even if the network preferences are disabled.The X11 server does not enforce the "Allow connections from network client" preference in the Security Preferences Panel. A remote network client can connect to the X11 server regardless of the configuration setting.Versions prior to Mac OS X 10.5 are not affected.
CVE-2008-0037.extra: A remote network client can connect to the X11 server regardless of the configuration setting.

CVE-2008-0038.title: Mac OS X Time Machine Backup Lets Local Users Execute Deleted Applications
CVE-2008-0038.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Time Machine backup feature. A local user can execute applications that have been deleted.A local user can invoke Launch Services to execute an application that was backed up using Time Machine but later deleted from the system.Systems prior to version 10.5 are not affected.Steven Fisher of Discovery Software Ltd. and Ian Coutier reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0038.extra: A local user can execute deleted applications on the target system.

CVE-2008-0039.title: Apple Mail 'file' URL Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Local Applications
CVE-2008-0039.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Mail. A remote user can cause local applications to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted 'file://' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute specified applications residing on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Systems running Mac OS X v10.5 or later are not affected.
CVE-2008-0039.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute a specified application on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0040.title: NFS Buffer Overflow in Processing mbuf Chains Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0040.body: A vulnerability was reported in NFS on Mac OS X. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Other operating systems may be affected.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Both client and server implementations are affected.Mac OS X version 10.5 and 10.5.1 are affected. Other vendor operating systems may be affected.Oleg Drokin of Sun Microsystems reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0040.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0041.title: Apple Parental Controls Discloses Status Information to Remote Users
CVE-2008-0041.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Parental Controls. A remote user can determine when a website is unblocked.The system contacts an Apple web site (www.apple.com) when a website is unblocked. A remote user monitoring the network can determine when a website is unblocked.Jesse Pearson reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0041.extra: A remote user can determine when a website is unblocked.

CVE-2008-0042.title: Mac OS X Terminal Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Applications
CVE-2008-0042.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X. A remote user can cause specified applications to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user from within Terminal, will cause a specified application on the target user's system to be executed with user-supplied command line arguments. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Olli Leppanen of Digital Film Finland and Brian Mastenbrook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0042.extra: A remote user can create URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute applications on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0043.title: iPhoto Photocast Format String Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0043.body: A vulnerability was reported in iPhoto. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted photocast that, when accessed by the target user, will trigger a format string flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Nathan McFeters of Ernst & Young's Advanced Security Center reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0043.extra: A remote user can create a photocast that, when accessed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0044.title: Apple File Protocol Client Stack Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0044.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X Apple File Protocol (AFP) Client. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted 'afp://' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2008-0044.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0045.title: Apple File Protocol Server Kerberos Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
CVE-2008-0045.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Apple File Protocol (AFP) server. A remote user can bypass authentication.The server does not properly validate Kerberos principal realm names. When cross-realm authentication with and AFP Server is used, a remote user can bypass cross-realm authentication to connect to the server.Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected.Ragnar Sundblad of KTH - Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0045.extra: A remote user can bypass authentication and connect to the server.

CVE-2008-0046.title: Mac OS X Application Firewall German Language Preference Panel May Mislead Users and Incorrectly Permit Services to Accept Connections
CVE-2008-0046.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X in the Application Firewall. The German language preference pane is misleading.The German language translation of the Application Firewall preference pane listed the "Set access for specific services and applications" radio button as "Zugriff auf bestimmte Dienste und Programme festlegen" (i.e., "Set access to specific services and applications").A user may incorrectly believe that only the listed services are permitted to accept incoming connections.Mac OS X versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.
CVE-2008-0046.extra: A user may incorrectly believe that only the listed services are permitted to accept incoming connections.

CVE-2008-0047.title: CUPS Heap Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0047.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS (Common UNIX Printing System). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 631 to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on February 26, 2008.regenrecht reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0047.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0048.title: Apple AppKit Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0048.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in AppKit. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke the NSDocument API with a specially crafted filename to trigger a stack overflow and, on some filesystems, execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0048]. On most filesystems, code execution is not possible.A local user can also access a mach port in NSApplication and send specially crafted messages to privileged applications in the same bootstrap namespace to cause the target application to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-0049].Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0048.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0049.title: Apple AppKit Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0049.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in AppKit. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke the NSDocument API with a specially crafted filename to trigger a stack overflow and, on some filesystems, execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0048]. On most filesystems, code execution is not possible.A local user can also access a mach port in NSApplication and send specially crafted messages to privileged applications in the same bootstrap namespace to cause the target application to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-0049].Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0049.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0050.title: Safari CFNetwork Bug Lets Remote Proxy Servers Spoof Secure Web Sites
CVE-2008-0050.body: A vulnerability was reported in Safari. A remote user can spoof a secure web site.A remote proxy server can return a specially crafted 502 Bad Gateway error that, when loaded by the browser's CFNetwork component, will spoof a secure web site.This vulnerability has already been fixed for Mac OS X (in version 10.5.2, and in Security Update 2008-002 for Mac OS X 10.4.11).
CVE-2008-0050.extra: A remote user can spoof a secure web site.

CVE-2008-0051.title: Apple CoreFoundation Integer Overflow in Processing Time Zone Data Lets Local Users Obtain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0051.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Mac OS X CoreFoundation. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can supply specially crafted time zone data to trigger an integer overflow in CoreFoundation and execute arbitrary code with system privileges.Mac OS X versions 10.5 or later are not affected.
CVE-2008-0051.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0052.title: Mac OS X CoreServices Lets Remote Users Open Certain Files Using AppleWorks
CVE-2008-0052.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X CoreServices. A remote user can cause certain files to be opened in AppleWorks on the target user's system.If the "Open 'Safe' files" preference is enabled in Safari, a remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will open the specified remote '.ief' file using AppleWorks.Only systems prior to Mac OS X v10.5 that have AppleWorks installed are affected.
CVE-2008-0052.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause a remote '.ief' file to be opened on target user's system using AppleWorks.

CVE-2008-0053.title: CUPS Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code or Deny Service
CVE-2008-0053.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause the system to crash or execute arbitrary code.Apple reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0053.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0054.title: Mac OS X Foundation Bugs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0054.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Foundation. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A specially crafted selector name to the NSSelectorFromString API to trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0054].When a target user performs a recursive file copying operation, the NSFileManager function creates directories, temporarily with world-writable privileges. A local user can modify the directories to potentially gain elevated privileges [CVE-2008-0055].A pathname with a specially crafted structure can trigger a stack overflow in NSFileManager [CVE-2008-0056].Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0054.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0056.title: Mac OS X Foundation Bugs Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0056.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Foundation. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A specially crafted selector name to the NSSelectorFromString API to trigger code execution [CVE-2008-0054].When a target user performs a recursive file copying operation, the NSFileManager function creates directories, temporarily with world-writable privileges. A local user can modify the directories to potentially gain elevated privileges [CVE-2008-0055].A pathname with a specially crafted structure can trigger a stack overflow in NSFileManager [CVE-2008-0056].Mac OS X versions 10.5 and later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0056.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0057.title: Apple AppKit Integer and Stack Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0057.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in AppKit. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted serialized property list that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0057]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerability resides in a parser for a legacy serialization format.A remote user that can cause a target user to query a network printer and then supply a specially rafted PPD file can trigger a stack overflow and cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system [CVE-2008-0997].Mac OS X versions 10.5 or later are not affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0057.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0060.title: Apple Help Viewer Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary JavaScript
CVE-2008-0060.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Help Viewer. A remote user can cause arbitrary JavaScript to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted 'help:' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript into the generated 'help:topic_list' page contents.Brian Mastenbrook reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0060.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary JavaScript on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0062.title: Kerberos KDC Double-Free Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service, Obtain Information, or Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0062.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kerberos KDC. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions, obtain information, or execute arbitrary code.A remote user can send a specially crafted Kerberos 4 message to trigger a null pointer dereference, causing the target KDC to crash or return portions of arbitrary memory locations as part of an error message. The remote user can also trigger a double-free to potentially execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-0062.extra: A remote user can cause the target KDC to crash, disclose information, or execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-0063.title: Kerberos KDC Stack Initialization Bug May Disclose Stack Data to Remote Users
CVE-2008-0063.body: A vulnerability was reported in Kerberos KDC. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can send a specially crafted Kerberos 4 message to cause uninitialized stack data to be used in place of missing portions of the Kerberos 4 message. Some information from the stack may be returned to the remote user as part of an error message.
CVE-2008-0063.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the stack.

CVE-2008-0066.title: IBM Lotus Notes Buffer Overflows in HTML Speed Reader Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0066.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Lotus Notes in the HTML Speed Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when viewed by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerability resides in 'htmsr.dll'.Specially crafted BODY tag 'background' attribute values can trigger a stack overflow.Specially crafted IMG tag 'src' attribute values can trigger a stack overflow.Specially crafted chunks of data can trgger a heap overflow.The vendor was notified on January 7, 2008.The vendor has assigned SPR# PRAD7AP563 to this vulnerability.Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0066.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when viewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0067.title: HP OpenView Network Node Manager Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0067.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP OpenView Network Node Manager. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.OpenView5.exe, ov.dll, getcvdata.exe, ovlaunch.exe, and Toolbar.exe are affected.The vendor was notified on January 7, 2008.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2008-13/JJ Reyes of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0067.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0068.title: HP OpenView Network Node Manager Input Validation Flaw in 'OpenView5.exe' Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory
CVE-2008-0068.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP OpenView Network Node Manager. A remote user can view files on the target system.The 'OpenView5.exe' script does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/OvCgi/OpenView5.exe?Target=Main&Action=../../../../../../windows/win.iniLuigi Auriemma reported this vulnerability. JJ Reyes of Secunia Research independently reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0068.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2008-0068.title: HP OpenView Network Node Manager ovalarmsrv and ovtopmd Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0068.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP OpenView Network Node Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 2954 cause the target 'ovalarmsrv' service to hang or crash.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 2532 cause the target 'ovtopmd' service to crash.Demonstration exploit code is available at:http://aluigi.org/poc/closedviewx.zipLuigi Auriemma reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0068.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2008-0071.title: uTorrent Web User Interface Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
CVE-2008-0071.body: A vulnerability was reported in uTorrent. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request 'Range' header parameter to cause the target application to crash.Systems with the web user interface enabled (not the default configuration) are affected.The vendor was notified on January 31, 2008.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0071.extra: A remote user can cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-0071.title: BitTorrent Web User Interface Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
CVE-2008-0071.body: A vulnerability was reported in BitTorrent. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request 'Range' header parameter to cause the target application to crash.Systems with the web user interface enabled (not the default configuration) are affected.The vendor was notified on January 31, 2008.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0071.extra: A remote user can cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-0073.title: xine Buffer Overflow in sdpplin_parse() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0073.body: A vulnerability was reported in xine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an RTSP stream with a specially crafted 'streamid' SDP parameter that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the sdpplin_parse() function in 'input/libreal/sdpplin.c' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on March 10, 2008.Alin Rad Pop Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://secunia.com/secunia_research/2008-10/advisory/
CVE-2008-0073.extra: A remote user can create an RTSP stream that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0074.title: Microsoft Internet Information Services File Change Notification Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0074.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Information Services. A local user can obtain system level privileges on the target system.A local user with privileges to create or modify files in the FTPRoot, NNTPFile\Root, or WWWRoot directories can cause the web service to execute arbitrary code on the target system with system privileges.
CVE-2008-0074.extra: A local user can obtain system privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0075.title: Microsoft Internet Information Services Error in Processing ASP Page Input Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0075.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Information Services. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted input to an ASP page to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target Worker Process Identity (WPI) process.
CVE-2008-0075.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0076.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer HTML Layout Rendering Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0076.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer in rendering certain HTML layout combinations. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML with specially crafted layout combinations that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Shane Macaulay and Riley Hassell of Security Objectives reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0076.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0077.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Property Method Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0077.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML with a specially crafted property method that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher reported this via TippingPoint and hyy reported this via VeriSign iDefense.
CVE-2008-0077.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0078.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Argument Validation Flaw in 'dxtmsft.dll' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0078.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer in the processing of certain image arguments. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted image that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the 'dxtmsft.dll' ActiveX control and trigger a memory corruption error to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Venustech of ADLABS reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0078.extra: A remote user can create an image that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0080.title: Windows WebDAV Mini-Redirector Response Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0080.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows WebDAV Mini-Redirector. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted WebDAV responses to trigger an error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Windows 2000 SP4 and Vista SP1 are not affected.Steven of COSEINC Vulnerability Research Lab reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0080.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0082.title: Windows Messenger ActiveX Control Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Information and Perform Chat Functions
CVE-2008-0082.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Messenger. A remote user can obtain information and initiate chat sessions.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit an ActiveX control (Messenger.UIAutomation.1) to perform actions on the target user's Messenger client. The remote user can change state, obtain contact information, and initiate audio and video chat sessions without the knowledge of the target user. The remote user can also login to a Messenger session using the target user's identity.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: B69003B3-C55E-4b48-836C-BC5946FC3B28Haifei Li of Fortinet s FortiGuard Global Security Research Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0082.extra: A remote user can obtain information and perform chat functions.

CVE-2008-0083.title: Windows VBScript and JScript Scripting Engine Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0083.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows VBScript and JScript Scripting Engines. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted scripting code that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The code can be contained within a file or remote web site.Peter Ferrie of Symantec reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0083.extra: A remote user can create scripting code that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0085.title: Microsoft SQL Server Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0085.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SQL Server. A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.The server does not initialize memory pages when reallocating memory [CVE-2008-0085]. A remote authenticated user with database operator access can access customer data.A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted input string to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0086].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted insert statement to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0106].The server does not properly validate data structures in on-disk files. A remote authenticated user can exploit this to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0107].Brett Moore of Insomnia Security reported the memory corruption vulnerability via iDefense. Anonymous researchers reported the other vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0085.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data.A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0086.title: Microsoft SQL Server Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0086.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SQL Server. A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.The server does not initialize memory pages when reallocating memory [CVE-2008-0085]. A remote authenticated user with database operator access can access customer data.A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted input string to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0086].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted insert statement to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0106].The server does not properly validate data structures in on-disk files. A remote authenticated user can exploit this to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0107].Brett Moore of Insomnia Security reported the memory corruption vulnerability via iDefense. Anonymous researchers reported the other vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0086.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data.A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0087.title: Windows DNS Client Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
CVE-2008-0087.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows DNS Client. A remote user can spoof the target user's DNS.A remote user can send specially crafted data in response to the target user's DNS request to cause the target user's traffic to be directed to an arbitrary location.Amit Klein of Trusteer, Alla Berzroutchko of Scanit, and Roy Arends of Nominet UK reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0087.extra: A remote user can conduct DNS spoofing attacks against the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0088.title: Active Directory LDAP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0088.body: A vulnerability was reported in Active Directory. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted LDAP requests to cause the target system to become non-responsive and restart.On Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP, authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.Thomas Garnier of SkyRecon reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0088.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to become non-responsive and restart.

CVE-2008-0095.title: Asterisk SIP Channel Driver Can Be Crashed By Remote Users With 'BYE with Also' Method
CVE-2008-0095.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted BYE message using the 'BYE with Also' transfer method to trigger a NULL pointer error cause the target service to crash.The vendor was notified on December 26, 2007.Grey VoIP reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0095.extra: A remote user can the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-0098.title: RealPlayer Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0098.body: A vulnerability was reported in RealPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted media stream that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A demonstration is available at:http://gleg.net/realplayer11.htmlThe exploit is available as part of VulnDisco.Evgeny Legerov reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0098.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0102.title: Microsoft Office Publisher Invalid Memory Reference Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0102.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office Publisher. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Publisher (.pub) file that, when loaded by the target user, will reference an invalid memory location and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Bing Liu of Fortinet Security Research and Piotr Bania reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0102.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0103.title: Microsoft Office Object Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0103.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an Office document containing a specially crafted object that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Office 2003 SP3, Excel Viewer 2003, PowerPoint 2003 Viewer, Visio 2003 Viewer, Word Viewer 2003, 2007 Microsoft Office System, 2007 Microsoft Office System SP1, and Office 2008 for Mac are not affected.Shaun Colley of NGSSoftware reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0103.extra: A remote user can create an Office file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0104.title: Microsoft Office Publisher Memory Corruption Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0104.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office Publisher. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Publisher (.pub) file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Bing Liu of Fortinet Security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0104.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0105.title: Microsoft Works/Microsoft Office Bug in Processing '.wps' Header Index Table Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0105.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Works and Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a '.wps' file with specially crafted header index table information that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Microsoft Office, Microsoft Works, and Microsoft Works Suite are affected.Microsoft Works 8.5 and 9.0, Microsoft Works Suite 2006, 2007 Microsoft Office System, Office 2000, and Office XP are not affected.IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0105.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0106.title: Microsoft SQL Server Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0106.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SQL Server. A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.The server does not initialize memory pages when reallocating memory [CVE-2008-0085]. A remote authenticated user with database operator access can access customer data.A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted input string to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0086].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted insert statement to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0106].The server does not properly validate data structures in on-disk files. A remote authenticated user can exploit this to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0107].Brett Moore of Insomnia Security reported the memory corruption vulnerability via iDefense. Anonymous researchers reported the other vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0106.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data.A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0107.title: Microsoft SQL Server Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0107.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SQL Server. A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.The server does not initialize memory pages when reallocating memory [CVE-2008-0085]. A remote authenticated user with database operator access can access customer data.A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted input string to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0086].A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted insert statement to trigger a buffer overflow in the convert function to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0106].The server does not properly validate data structures in on-disk files. A remote authenticated user can exploit this to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-0107].Brett Moore of Insomnia Security reported the memory corruption vulnerability via iDefense. Anonymous researchers reported the other vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0107.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain customer data.A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0108.title: Microsoft Works/Microsoft Office Bug in Processing '.wps' Field Length Values Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0108.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Works and Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a '.wps' file with specially crafted field length values that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Microsoft Office, Microsoft Works, and Microsoft Works Suite are affected.Microsoft Works 8.5 and 9.0, Microsoft Works Suite 2006, 2007 Microsoft Office System, Office 2000, and Office XP are not affected.VeriSign iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0108.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0109.title: Microsoft Word Memory Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0109.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Word. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Word file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Office 2003 SP3, Office XP SP3, and Office 2000 SP2 are affected.Office 2003 SP3, Word Viewer 2003 SP3, 2007 Microsoft Office System, 2007 Microsoft Office System SP1, Office 2004 for Mac, and Office 2008 for Mac are not affected.Ruben Santamarta of Reversemode.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0109.extra: A remote user can create a Word document that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0110.title: Microsoft Outlook 'mailto:' URL Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0110.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Outlook. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted mailto URL that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0110.extra: A remote user can create a mailto URL that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0111.title: Microsoft Excel Input Validation Bug in Processing Data Validation Records Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0111.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an error in the processing of data validation records and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0111.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0112.title: Microsoft Excel Flaw in Importing '.slk' Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0112.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.slk' file that, when imported into Excel by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Yoshiya Sasaki of JFE Systems reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0112.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when imported into Excel by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0113.title: Microsoft Office and Excel Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0113.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel or Office file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Excel file can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2008-0113].A specially crafted Office file can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2008-0118].An anonymous researcher reported one of the vulnerabilities. Arnaud Dovi reported the other vulnerability via Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2008-0113.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0114.title: Microsoft Excel Input Validation Bug in Processing Style Record Data Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0114.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Excel in the processing of style record data. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an Excel file with specially crafted style record information that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Bing Liu of Fortinet reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0114.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0115.title: Microsoft Excel Formula Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0115.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Excel in the parsing of forumulas. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an Excel file with a specially crafted formula that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory calculation error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.iDefense Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0115.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0116.title: Microsoft Excel Input Validation Bug in Processing Rich Text Data Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0116.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Excel in the processing of rich text values. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an Excel file with specially crafted rich text data that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Cody Pierce of TippingPoint DVLabs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0116.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0118.title: Microsoft Office and Excel Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0118.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Excel or Office file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Excel file can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2008-0113].A specially crafted Office file can trigger arbitrary code execution [CVE-2008-0118].An anonymous researcher reported one of the vulnerabilities. Arnaud Dovi reported the other vulnerability via Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2008-0118.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0119.title: Microsoft Publisher Bug in Processing Object Header Data Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0119.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Publisher. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a Publisher file with specially crafted object header data that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Cocoruder of Fortinet Security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0119.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0120.title: Microsoft PowerPoint Memory Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0120.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft PowerPoint. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PowerPoint file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Ruben Santamarta of Reversemode.com via iDefense and ADLab of Venustech reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0120.extra: A remote user can create a PowerPoint file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0121.title: Microsoft PowerPoint Memory Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0121.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft PowerPoint. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PowerPoint file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Ruben Santamarta of Reversemode.com via iDefense and ADLab of Venustech reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0121.extra: A remote user can create a PowerPoint file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0122.title: FreeBSD libc Buffer Overflow in inet_network() May Let Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0122.body: A vulnerability was reported in libc on FreeBSD. A user may be able to deny service or execute arbitrary code on the target system.A user may be able to supply specially crafted data to the inet_network() function to overwrite memory and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the program calling the function.Bjoern A. Zeeb and Nate Eldredge reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0122.extra: A user may be able to deny service or execute arbitrary code on the target system. The specific impact depends on the program calling the vulnerable function.

CVE-2008-0124.title: Serendipity Input Validation Hole in Multi-User Back End Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0124.body: A vulnerability was reported in Serendipity. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.When configured for a multi-user environment, the back end does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Serendipity software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'Real name' field in the 'Personal Settings' Dialogue is affected.The media library allows a remote authenticated user to upload files in arbitrary formats.The vendor was notified on February 1, 2008.The original advisory is available at:http://int21.de/cve/CVE-2008-0124-s9y.htmlHanno Boeck of schokokeks.org reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0124.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Serendipity software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0127.title: McAfee E-Business Server Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0127.body: A vulnerability was reported in McAfee E-Business Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted authentication data to TCP port 1718 to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with Local System privileges.Only the Windows-based version is affected.The vendor was notified on November 28, 2007.Leon Juranic of INFIGO IS reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.infigo.hr/en/in_focus/advisories/INFIGO-2008-01-06A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.infigo.hr/files/mcafee2.pl
CVE-2008-0127.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with Local System privileges.

CVE-2008-0166.title: OpenSSL for Debian/Ubuntu Predictable RNG Lets Remote Users Determine Cryptographic Keys
CVE-2008-0166.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL on Debian and Ubuntu Linux. A remote user can determine keys.The OpenSSL random number generator creates keys in a predictable manner. A remote user can conduct guessing attacks to determine cryptographic keys.Systems based on Debian Linux are affected, including Ubuntu Linux.All cryptographic keys generated may be affected, including SSH keys, OpenVPN keys, DNSSEC keys, keys used in X.509 certificates, and session keys used in SSL/TLS connections.GnuPG and GNUTLS keys are not affected.Luciano Bello reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0166.extra: A remote user can determine keys.

CVE-2008-0174.title: Proficy Default Login Method Does Not Encrypt User Passwords
CVE-2008-0174.body: A vulnerability was reported in Proficy. A remote user monitoring the network can obtain user authentication data.The system sends usernames and passwords in clear text (using the HTTP Basic authentication method). A remote user monitoring the network between the target user's browser and the target system can obtain user authentication data.Eyal Udassin of C4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0174.extra: A remote user monitoring the network can obtain user authentication data.

CVE-2008-0176.title: CIMPLICITY Heap Overflow in 'w32rtr.exe' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0176.body: A vulnerability was reported in CIMPLICITY. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to port 32000 on the target system to trigger a heap overflow in the 'w32rtr.exe' process and execute arbitrary code on the target system.Gilad Bakas and Eyal Udassin of C4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0176.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0212.title: HP OpenView Network Node Manager 'ovtopmd' Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0212.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP OpenView Network Node Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 2532 to cause the 'ovtopmd' service to crash.The vendor was notified on May 14, 2007.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via VeriSign iDefense.
CVE-2008-0212.extra: A remote user can cause the 'ovtopmd' service to crash.

CVE-2008-0213.title: HP Virtual Rooms Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0213.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Virtual Rooms. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.The CLSID of the HP Virtual Rooms (HPVR) ActiveX control is: 00000014-9593-4264-8B29-930B3E4EDCCD
CVE-2008-0213.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0214.title: HP Select Identity Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Access
CVE-2008-0214.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Select Identity. A remote authenticated user can gain access to the target application.A remote authenticated user can exploit unspecified flaws to gain unauthorized access.
CVE-2008-0214.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain access to the target application.

CVE-2008-0215.title: HP Storage Essentials Storage Resource Management Software Grants Remote Users Access to Managed Devices
CVE-2008-0215.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Storage Essentials Storage Resource Management software. A remote user can access managed devices.A remote user can exploit an unspecified flaw in the Storage Resource Management software to gain access to a managed device.Both Standard Edition and Enterprise Edition versions are affected.
CVE-2008-0215.extra: A remote user can access managed devices.

CVE-2008-0216.title: FreeBSD pty May Disclose Information to Local Users
CVE-2008-0216.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in FreeBSD pty. A local user can monitor a target user's pty.If a local, non-root target user runs script(1) or other programs that use openpty(3), the pseudo-terminal is world readable and world writable. A local user can obtain the text printed to the target user's terminal [CVE-2008-0217].The ptsname(3) function does not properly validate device node names. A local user can read the content of a target user's pty [CVE-2008-0216]. Only FreeBSD 6.0 and later is affected by the ptsname vulnerability.John Baldwin reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0216.extra: A local user can monitor a target non-root user's pty.

CVE-2008-0217.title: FreeBSD pty May Disclose Information to Local Users
CVE-2008-0217.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in FreeBSD pty. A local user can monitor a target user's pty.If a local, non-root target user runs script(1) or other programs that use openpty(3), the pseudo-terminal is world readable and world writable. A local user can obtain the text printed to the target user's terminal [CVE-2008-0217].The ptsname(3) function does not properly validate device node names. A local user can read the content of a target user's pty [CVE-2008-0216]. Only FreeBSD 6.0 and later is affected by the ptsname vulnerability.John Baldwin reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0217.extra: A local user can monitor a target non-root user's pty.

CVE-2008-0223.title: Ichitaro Buffer Overflow in Processing jtd Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0223.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ichitaro. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.jtd' file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Several JustSystems products are affected.
CVE-2008-0223.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0229.title: LevelOne WBR-3460A Wireless Router Grants Management Access to Remote Users
CVE-2008-0229.body: Anastasios Monachos reported a vulnerability in the LevelOne WBR-3460A router. A remote user can gain access to the management interface.A remote user on the internal network or the wireless network can connect to the management interface via telnet. No authentication is required.The remote user can access files on the target device to obtain the web administration password and other potentially sensitive information and to modify the configuration.The vendor was notified on January 1, 2008 without response.
CVE-2008-0229.extra: A remote user can gain access to the target device.

CVE-2008-0234.title: QuickTime Buffer Overflow in Processing HTTP 404 Response Messages Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0234.body: Luigi Auriemma reported a vulnerability in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an 'rtsp://' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the player to connect to a remote server. If TCP port 554 on the specified remote server is not available, the player will connect via TCP port 80. A specially crafted HTTP 404 response from the remote server can trigger a buffer overflow in the target user's player and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The buffer overflow occurs during the display of connection status.A demonstration exploit response is available at:http://aluigi.org/poc/quicktimebof.txt
CVE-2008-0234.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0239.title: Sun Java System Identity Manager Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0239.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Java System Identity Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Sun Java System Identity Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Adrian Pastor and Jan Fry of ProCheckUp Ltd. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0239.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Sun Java System Identity Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0244.title: MaxDB 'cons.exe' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
CVE-2008-0244.body: Luigi Auriemma reported a vulnerability in MaxDB. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can connect to the target database and execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system.A demonstration exploit command (for Windows) is provided:exec_sdbinfo && echo dir c:\ | cmd.exeA demonstration exploit is available at:http://aluigi.org/poc/sapone.zip
CVE-2008-0244.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

CVE-2008-0247.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Express Server Heap Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0247.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Storage Manager Express Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the backup server service on TCP port 1500 to trigger a buffer overflow in 'dsmsvc.exe' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with System level privileges.The vendor was notified on December 5, 2007.Sebastian Apelt and Tenable Network Security separately reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-0247.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with System privileges.

CVE-2008-0263.title: Ingate Firewall Lets Remote Users Consume All Available SIP Media Ports
CVE-2008-0263.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ingate Firewall. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.In certain call hold and send-only stream situations, SIP media ports are not reused. A remote user can consume all available SIP media ports, preventing new calls from being set up.
CVE-2008-0263.extra: A remote user can prevent calls.

CVE-2008-0263.title: Ingate SIParator Lets Remote Users Consume All Available SIP Media Ports
