CVE-2008-0263.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ingate SIParator. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.In certain call hold and send-only stream situations, SIP media ports are not reused. A remote user can consume all available SIP media ports, preventing new calls from being set up.
CVE-2008-0263.extra: A remote user can prevent calls.

CVE-2008-0265.title: BIG-IP Input Validation Hole in SearchString Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0265.body: A vulnerability was reported in BIG-IP. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The search function on several script pages does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the BIG-IP device and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The SearchString parameter in the following scripts is affected:/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/virtual_server/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/http/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/ftp/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/rtsp/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/sip/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/persistence/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/fastl4/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/fasthttp/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/httpclass/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/tcp/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/udp/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/sctp/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/clientssl/list.jsp /tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/serverssl/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/authn/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/connpool/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/statistics/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/stream/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/pool/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/node/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/monitor/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/ssl_certificate/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/user/list.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_system.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_pktfilter.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_ltm.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/resources_audit.jsp/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_asm.jspA demonstration exploit URL is provided:https://[target]/[page]?SearchString=%22%20type=%22hidden%22%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22list-xss%22)%3C/script%3E%3Cinput%20type=%22hidden%22%20value=%22The vendor was notified on January 3, 2008.nnposter reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0265.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the BIG-IP device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0304.title: Mozilla Thunderbird Buffer Overflow in Parsing External-Body MIME Content
CVE-2008-0304.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Thunderbird. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an e-mail message with specially crafted external-body MIME type content that, when previewed by the target user using the Preview Pane, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on January 14, 2008.regenrecht reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0304.extra: A remote user can create an e-mail message that, when previewed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0307.title: MaxDB 'vserver' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0307.body: A vulnerability was reported in MaxDB in the 'vserver' process. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 7210 to trigger a signedness error in 'vserver', overflowing the heap and potentially executing arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The remote user must supply the name of an active database on the server as part of the request.The vendor was notified on December 6, 2007.iDefense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0307.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0308.title: Symantec Anti Virus Decomposer Memory Consumption and Buffer Overflow Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0308.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Anti Virus in the Symantec Decomposer component. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted RAR archive that, when processed by the target application, will cause excessive memory consumption [CVE-2008-0308].A remote user can create a specially crafted RAR archive that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and cause the Decomposer to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-0309].The vulnerabilities can be triggered by sending the archive to the scan engine on TCP port 1134 using the Internet Content Adaptation Protocol (ICAP).The following products are affected:Symantec AntiVirus for Network Attached StorageSymantec AntiVirus Scan EngineSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for CachingSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for ClearswiftSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for MessagingSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for MS ISASymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for MS SharePointSymantec AntiVirus/Filtering for Domino MPE(AIX, Linux, Solaris)Symantec Mail Security for Microsoft Exchange and Symantec Scan Engine are also affected.Symantec AntiVirus Corporate Edition is not affected.The vendor was notified on June 14, 2007.iDefense reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0308.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will cause the application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-0309.title: Symantec Anti Virus Decomposer Memory Consumption and Buffer Overflow Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0309.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Symantec Anti Virus in the Symantec Decomposer component. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted RAR archive that, when processed by the target application, will cause excessive memory consumption [CVE-2008-0308].A remote user can create a specially crafted RAR archive that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow and cause the Decomposer to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-0309].The vulnerabilities can be triggered by sending the archive to the scan engine on TCP port 1134 using the Internet Content Adaptation Protocol (ICAP).The following products are affected:Symantec AntiVirus for Network Attached StorageSymantec AntiVirus Scan EngineSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for CachingSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for ClearswiftSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for MessagingSymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for MS ISASymantec AntiVirus Scan Engine for MS SharePointSymantec AntiVirus/Filtering for Domino MPE(AIX, Linux, Solaris)Symantec Mail Security for Microsoft Exchange and Symantec Scan Engine are also affected.Symantec AntiVirus Corporate Edition is not affected.The vendor was notified on June 14, 2007.iDefense reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0309.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will cause the application to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-0310.title: SCO UnixWare pkgadd Directory Traversal Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0310.body: A vulnerability was reported in pkgadd on SCO UnixWare. A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A local user can set specially crafted environment variable values to cause pkgadd to create or append to arbitrary files on the target system with root privileges.The vendor was notified on September 4, 2007.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0310.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0311.title: Borland CaliberRM Buffer Overflow in StarTeam Multicast Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0311.body: A vulnerability was reported in Borland CaliberRM. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 3057 to trigger a buffer overflow in the StarTeam Multicast Service component and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with System privilegesThe vendor was notified on March 20, 2007.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0311.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code with System privileges.

CVE-2008-0312.title: Norton AntiVirus 'SYMADATA.DLL' ActiveX Control Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0312.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Norton Anti-Virus in the Symantec AutoFix Tool ActiveX control. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in 'SYMADATA.DLL' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.If the target user's system allows access to remote shares via WebDAV or SMB, a remote user can cause arbitrary code from the remote share to be executed on the target user's system.The vendor reports that the ActiveX control can only be scripted from a trusted domain (i.e., a Symantec web site).The vendor was notified on December 5, 2007.Peter Vreugdenhill and an anonymous researcher reported these vulnerabilties via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0312.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0312.title: Norton Internet Security 'SYMADATA.DLL' ActiveX Control Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0312.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Norton Internet Security in the Symantec AutoFix Tool ActiveX control. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in 'SYMADATA.DLL' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.If the target user's system allows access to remote shares via WebDAV or SMB, a remote user can cause arbitrary code from the remote share to be executed on the target user's system.The vendor reports that the ActiveX control can only be scripted from a trusted domain (i.e., a Symantec web site).The vendor was notified on December 5, 2007.Peter Vreugdenhill and an anonymous researcher reported these vulnerabilties via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0312.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0312.title: Norton System Works 'SYMADATA.DLL' ActiveX Control Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0312.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Norton System Works in the Symantec AutoFix Tool ActiveX control. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in 'SYMADATA.DLL' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.If the target user's system allows access to remote shares via WebDAV or SMB, a remote user can cause arbitrary code from the remote share to be executed on the target user's system.The vendor reports that the ActiveX control can only be scripted from a trusted domain (i.e., a Symantec web site).The vendor was notified on December 5, 2007.Peter Vreugdenhill and an anonymous researcher reported these vulnerabilties via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0312.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0314.title: Clam AntiVirus Heap Overflow in Processing PeSpin Packed Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0314.body: A vulnerability was reported in Clam AntiVirus. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PE binary file packed with the PeSpin executable protector that, when loaded by the target application, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.The vulnerability resides in 'libclamav/spin.c'.The vendor was notified on March 4, 2008.Damian Put reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0314.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0318.title: Clam AntiVirus Integer Overflow in Processing PE Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0318.body: A vulnerability was reported in Clam AntiVirus. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PE file that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.The vendor was notified on January 7, 2008.Silvio Cesare reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0318.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0320.title: OpenOffice Heap Overflow in Processing OLE Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0320.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice.org Office Suite. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted OLE file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0320.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0322.title: Microsoft Windows XP 'i2omgmt.sys' Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0322.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows XP. A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can access the \\.\I2OExc interface of the Intelligent Input/Output (I2O) Utility Filter driver (i2omgmt.sys) and supply a specially crafted DeviceObject pointer value to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel privileges.The vendor was notified on March 20, 2007.Ruben Santamarta of reversemode.com reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-0322.extra: A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0324.title: Cisco VPN Client IOCTL Memory Corruption Error Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0324.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco VPN Client. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can send a specially crafted IOCTL to trigger a kernel memory corruption error and cause the target system to crash.The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.digit-labs.org/files/exploits/cvpndrv-dos.cmu-b reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0324.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-0354.title: Lotus Sametime Input Validation Hole in Chat Client Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0354.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sametime. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The Sametime Chat client not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's client via the mouse-over action. The code will run in the security context of the chat client. As a result, the code will be able to take actions on the client acting as the target user.Secunia reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0354.extra: A remote user can take actions on the client acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0356.title: Citrix Presentation Server Buffer Overflow in IMA Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0356.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citrix Presentation Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to the IMA service on TCP port 2512 or 2512 to trigger a buffer overflow in the IMA service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Citrix Access Essentials and Citrix Desktop Server are also affected.TippingPoint and the Zero Day Initiative reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0356.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0358.title: Pixelpost Input Validation Flaw in 'parent_id' Parameter Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2008-0358.body: A vulnerability was reported in Pixelpost. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted 'parent_id' parameter value to 'index.php' to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/4924Silentz reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0358.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2008-0365.title: CORE FORCE Buffer Overflows and Input Validation Flaws Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0365.body: A vulnerability was reported in CORE FORCE. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can make specially crafted IOCTL calls to trigger buffer overflows and memory corruption errors in the Firewall and Registry modules and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with kernel level privileges.The Windows Driver Kit DC2 application and the BSODHook application (from Matousec Security) can be used to trigger these vulnerabilities.The vendor was notified on November 4, 2007.Sebastian Gottschalk reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0365.extra: A local user execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.

CVE-2008-0366.title: CORE FORCE Buffer Overflows and Input Validation Flaws Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0366.body: A vulnerability was reported in CORE FORCE. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can make specially crafted IOCTL calls to trigger buffer overflows and memory corruption errors in the Firewall and Registry modules and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with kernel level privileges.The Windows Driver Kit DC2 application and the BSODHook application (from Matousec Security) can be used to trigger these vulnerabilities.The vendor was notified on November 4, 2007.Sebastian Gottschalk reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0366.extra: A local user execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.

CVE-2008-0379.title: Crystal Reports Buffer Overflow in 'EnterpriseControls.dll' ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0379.body: A vulnerability was reported in Crystal Reports. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the 'EnterpriseControls.dll' and cause the target application to crash.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 3D58C9F3-7CA5-4C44-9D62-C5B63E059050The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/4931shinnai reported this vulnerability.[Editor's note: The report indicates that a modified version of the safe-for-scripting ActiveX control can cause code execution and that the unmodified version will cause denial of service conditions.]
CVE-2008-0379.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to crash.

CVE-2008-0386.title: Xdg-Utils Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2008-0386.body: A vulnerability was reported in Xdg-Utils in certain commands. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.The "xdg-open" and "xdg-email" commands do not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can create a specially crafted link that, when loaded by the target user, will cause Xdg-Utils to execute arbitrary commands. The commands will run with the privileges of the target user.Miroslav Lichvar reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0386.extra: A remote user can create a link that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary commands on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0392.title: Microsoft Visual Basic '.dsr' File Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0392.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Visual Basic Enterprise Edition. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.shinnai reported this vulnerability.The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:http://shinnai.altervista.org/exploits/txt/TXT_XB3K5Y0Y0YvLnsJCyV12.html
CVE-2008-0392.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0394.title: Citadel Buffer Overflow in SMTP Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0394.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citadel. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted SMTP RCPT TO command to to trigger a buffer overflow in the SMTP service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.prdelka reported this vulnerability.The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/sploits/2008-vs-GNU-citadel.tar.gz
CVE-2008-0394.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0401.title: IBM Tivoli Provisioning Manager for OS Deployment Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0401.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM Tivoli Provisioning Manager for OS Deployment. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can supply an HTTP request with a specially crafted HTTP request method to trigger a buffer overflow in the web server's logging component. This may cause denial of service conditions on the HTTP server or may permit arbitrary code execution.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.The vendor was notified on October 24, 2007.[Editor's note: The vendor indicated this was a denial of service vulnerability. iDefense indicated that this allows remote users to "potentially execute arbitrary code." The iDefense report did not confirm code execution.]
CVE-2008-0401.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0402.title: IBM WebSphere Business Modeler Lets Remote Authenticated Users Delete Repository Objects
CVE-2008-0402.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Business Modeler. A remote authenticated user can delete objects from the target repository.A remote authenticated non-administrator user can delete objects from a repository. A remote authenticated user that is not within the group that owns the target repository can also delete objects from the repository.
CVE-2008-0402.extra: A remote authenticated user can delete objects from the target repository.

CVE-2008-0411.title: Ghostscript Stack Overflow in zseticcspace() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Codes
CVE-2008-0411.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ghostscript. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted ghostscript file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a stack overflow in the zseticcspace() function in 'zicc.c.' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Chris Evans of Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://scary.beasts.org/security/CESA-2008-001.html
CVE-2008-0411.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0412.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in Browser Engine Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0412.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox in the browser engine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption in the browser engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Jesse Ruderman, Kai Engert, Martijn Wargers, Mats Palmgren, and Paul Nickerson reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0412.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0413.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in JavaScript Engine Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0413.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox in the JavaScript engine. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the Javascript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Carsten Book, Wesley Garland, Igor Bukanov, moz_bug_r_a4, shutdown, Philip Taylor, and tgirmann reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0413.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0414.title: Mozilla Firefox Lets Remote Users Steal the Focus to Obtain Keystrokes
CVE-2008-0414.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will shift the focus to capture user input or force the user to upload a file.hong and Gregory Fleisher reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0414.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will capture the target user's input.

CVE-2008-0415.title: Mozilla Firefox JavaScript Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0415.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted JavaScript that, when loaded by the target user, will execute scripting code within the security domain of another site or possibly with chrome privileges.moz_bug_r_a4 and Boris Zbarsky reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0415.extra: A remote user can create JavaScript that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0417.title: Mozilla Firefox Lets Remote Web Sites Corrupt the Password Store in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-0417.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote web site can corrupt the target user's password store in certain cases.When the target user saves their password for a remote web site, the remote web site can inject newline characters into the browser's password store to corrupt saved passwords for other sites.Justin Dolske reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0417.extra: A remote web site can corrupt the target user's password store when the target user saves their password for that site.

CVE-2008-0418.title: Mozilla Firefox chrome: URI Directory Traversal Bug Lets Remote Users Load Local Files
CVE-2008-0418.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox when certain add-ons have been installed. A remote user can cause files on the target user's system to be loaded.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a flaw in the 'chrome:' URI scheme to load JavaScript, images, and stylesheets from known files on the target user's system. The system is affected only if add-ons that use "flat" packaging (instead of ".jar" packaging) have been used.This vulnerability can be exploited to obtain the contents of the 'sessionstore.js' file, which includes session cookie data and other potentially sensitive information.Gerry Eisenhaur and moz_bug_r_a4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0418.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load known files on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0419.title: Mozilla Firefox designMode Frames May Let Remote Users Obtain Information and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0419.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can obtain navigation information. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML containing designMode frames. When the target user navigates away from the page, the HTML can access the target user's navigation history and forward navigation information. The HTML can also cause the target user's browser to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.David Bloom reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0419.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain navigation information or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0420.title: Mozilla Firefox BMP Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Access Portions of Kernel Memory
CVE-2008-0420.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can view portions of kernel memory.A remote user create a specially crafted BMP file that, when loaded by the target user, will access uninitialized kernel memory.The information can be extracted using certain <canvas> methods.Gynvael Coldwind reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0420.extra: A remote user can view portions of kernel memory.

CVE-2008-0455.title: Apache mod_negotiation Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0455.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache mod_negotiation. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.The mod_negotiation module does not properly filter HTML code from filenames before displaying the input as part of an HTTP 406 Not Acceptable message and HTTP 300 Multiple Choices message. If a remote user can control a filename on the target system, the remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Apache software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can also exploit this to spoof content on the target server, attempt to poison any intermediate web caches, or conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A demonstration exploit filename is provided:.jpgThe vendor was notified on January 15, 2008.The original advisory is available at:http://www.mindedsecurity.com/MSA01150108.htmlStefano Di Paola of Minded Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0455.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Apache software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary content to be displayed.A remote user may be able to poison any intermediate web caches with arbitrary content.

CVE-2008-0456.title: Apache mod_negotiation Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0456.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache mod_negotiation. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct HTTP response splitting attacks.The mod_negotiation module does not properly filter HTML code from filenames before displaying the input as part of an HTTP 406 Not Acceptable message and HTTP 300 Multiple Choices message. If a remote user can control a filename on the target system, the remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Apache software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can also exploit this to spoof content on the target server, attempt to poison any intermediate web caches, or conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A demonstration exploit filename is provided:.jpgThe vendor was notified on January 15, 2008.The original advisory is available at:http://www.mindedsecurity.com/MSA01150108.htmlStefano Di Paola of Minded Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0456.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Apache software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary content to be displayed.A remote user may be able to poison any intermediate web caches with arbitrary content.

CVE-2008-0457.title: Symantec BackupExec System Recovery Manager Lets Remote Users Upload Arbitrary Files and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0457.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec BackupExec System Recovery Manager. A remote user can upload arbitrary files and then execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the FileUpload Class to upload arbitrary files to the target system. The remote user can then cause the web service to execute code in the uploaded files.The code will run with System privileges.The vendor was notified on December 11, 2007.Titon of BastardLabs reported this vulnerability via 3COM/TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-0457.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0466.title: Web Wiz Rich Text Editor Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory and Create HTML Files
CVE-2008-0466.body: AmnPardaz Security Research Team reported a vulnerability in Web Wiz Rich Text Editor. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can create HTML files on the target system.The 'RTE_file_browser.asp' script does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system that are located outside of the intended directory.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/RTE_file_browser.asp?look=save&sub=\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\A remote user can also exploit the 'RTE_popup_save_file.asp' script to create HTML files on the target system.The original advisory is available at:http://www.bugreport.ir/?/31
CVE-2008-0466.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can create HTML files on the target system.

CVE-2008-0467.title: Firebird Buffer Overflow in Processing 'username' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0467.body: A vulnerability was reported in Firebird. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted 'username' value to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Alex Peshkov reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://tracker.firebirdsql.org/browse/CORE-1603
CVE-2008-0467.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0473.title: Web Wiz Rich Text Editor Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory and Create HTML Files
CVE-2008-0473.body: AmnPardaz Security Research Team reported a vulnerability in Web Wiz Rich Text Editor. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can create HTML files on the target system.The 'RTE_file_browser.asp' script does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system that are located outside of the intended directory.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/RTE_file_browser.asp?look=save&sub=\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\A remote user can also exploit the 'RTE_popup_save_file.asp' script to create HTML files on the target system.The original advisory is available at:http://www.bugreport.ir/?/31
CVE-2008-0473.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can create HTML files on the target system.

CVE-2008-0477.title: Move Media Player Buffer Overflow in ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0477.body: A vulnerability was reported in Move Media Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke an ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow in 'QMPUpgrade.dll' to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 6054D082-355D-4B47-B77C-36A778899F48Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/4979
CVE-2008-0477.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0479.title: Web Wiz NewsPad Input Validation Flaw in 'FolderName' Parameter Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory
CVE-2008-0479.body: AmnPardaz Security Research Team reported a vulnerability in Web Wiz NewsPad. A remote user can view files on the target system.The 'RTE_file_browser.asp' script does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system that are located outside of the intended directory.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/RTE_file_browser.asp?look=&sub=\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\The original advisory is available at:http://www.bugreport.ir/?/30
CVE-2008-0479.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2008-0480.title: Web Wiz Forums Input Validation Flaw in 'FolderName' Parameter Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory
CVE-2008-0480.body: AmnPardaz Security Research Team reported a vulnerability in Web Wiz Forums. A remote user can view files on the target system.The 'RTE_file_browser.asp' and 'file_browser.asp' scripts do not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'FolderName' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system that are located outside of the intended directory.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/RTE_file_browser.asp?look=&sub=\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\The original advisory is available at:http://www.bugreport.ir/?/29
CVE-2008-0480.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2008-0481.title: Web Wiz Rich Text Editor Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory and Create HTML Files
CVE-2008-0481.body: AmnPardaz Security Research Team reported a vulnerability in Web Wiz Rich Text Editor. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can create HTML files on the target system.The 'RTE_file_browser.asp' script does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system that are located outside of the intended directory.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/RTE_file_browser.asp?look=save&sub=\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\.....\\\A remote user can also exploit the 'RTE_popup_save_file.asp' script to create HTML files on the target system.The original advisory is available at:http://www.bugreport.ir/?/31
CVE-2008-0481.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.A remote user can create HTML files on the target system.

CVE-2008-0485.title: MPlayer Pointer Dereference in 'demux_mov.c' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0485.body: A vulnerability was reported in MPlayer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.The MPlayer libmpdemux library in 'demux_mov.c' does not properly validate certain user-supplied tags within a MOV file before using the inputs to index an array. A remote user can create a specially crafted MOV file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a pointer dereference and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on January 18, 2008.The original advisory is available at:http://www.coresecurity.com/?action=item&id=2102Felipe Manzano and Anibal Sacco from Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0485.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0504.title: Coppermine Photo Gallery Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and SQL Injection Attacks
CVE-2008-0504.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Coppermine Photo Gallery. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated administrative user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can determine the installation path.The 'docs/showdoc.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Coppermine Photo Gallery software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'util.php' and 'reviewcom.php' scripts do not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated administrative user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote user can supply the following URL to determine the installation path:http://[target]/coppermine.1.4.14/include/slideshow.inc.phpA remote user can execute the 'update.php' to obtain potentially sensitive information about the system configuration.Janek Vind "waraxe" reported these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:http://www.waraxe.us/advisory-66.html
CVE-2008-0504.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Coppermine Photo Gallery software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote user can determine the installation path.

CVE-2008-0505.title: Coppermine Photo Gallery Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and SQL Injection Attacks
CVE-2008-0505.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Coppermine Photo Gallery. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote authenticated administrative user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can determine the installation path.The 'docs/showdoc.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Coppermine Photo Gallery software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'util.php' and 'reviewcom.php' scripts do not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated administrative user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote user can supply the following URL to determine the installation path:http://[target]/coppermine.1.4.14/include/slideshow.inc.phpA remote user can execute the 'update.php' to obtain potentially sensitive information about the system configuration.Janek Vind "waraxe" reported these vulnerabilities.The original advisory is available at:http://www.waraxe.us/advisory-66.html
CVE-2008-0505.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Coppermine Photo Gallery software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote user can determine the installation path.

CVE-2008-0506.title: Coppermine Photo Gallery Input Validation Flaw in 'imageObjectIM' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
CVE-2008-0506.body: A vulnerability was reported in Coppermine Photo Gallery in an include file. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.The 'include/imageObjectIM.class.php' script does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'quality', 'angle', and 'clipval' parameters. A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP POST request to execute arbitrary commands on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target web service.If ImageMagick is configured as the picture processing method (not the default configuration), the system is affected.Janek Vind "waraxe" reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.waraxe.us/advisory-65.html
CVE-2008-0506.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with the privileges of the target web service.

CVE-2008-0526.title: Cisco Unified IP Phone Can Be Crashed By Remote Users Sending an ICMP Echo Request Packet
CVE-2008-0526.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified IP Phone. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a large, specially crafted ICMP echo request packet to cause the target device to reboot.Cisco Unified IP Phone 7940, 7940G, 7960, and 7960G devices running SCCP firmware are affected.Cisco has iassigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsh71110 to this vulnerability.A Cisco customer reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
CVE-2008-0526.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reboot.

CVE-2008-0527.title: Cisco Unified IP Phone Can Be Crashed By Remote Users Sending an HTTP Request Packet
CVE-2008-0527.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified IP Phone. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to cause the target device to reboot.Cisco Unified IP Phone 7935 and 7936 devices running SCCP firmware are affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk20026 to this vulnerability.Sven Weizenegger of T-Systems reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0527.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reboot.

CVE-2008-0528.title: Cisco Unified IP Phone Buffer Overflow in Parsing MIME Encoded SIP Messages Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0528.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified IP Phone. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP message to trigger a buffer overflow in the parsing of MIME encoded messages and execute arbitrary code on the target system.Models 7940, 7940G, 7960 and 7960G devices running SIP firmware are affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj74786 to this vulnerability.Jon Griffin and Mustaque Ahamad of the School of Computer Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0528.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0529.title: Cisco Unified IP Phone Buffer Overflow in Telnet Server Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0529.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified IP Phone in the internal telnet server. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send enter a specially crafted command to trigger a buffer overflow in the telnet server and execute arbitrary code on the target device.The telnet server is disabled by default.Models 7940, 7940G, 7960 and 7960G running SIP firmware are affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj78359 to this vulnerability.Jon Griffin and Mustaque Ahamad of the School of Computer Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0529.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target device.

CVE-2008-0530.title: Cisco Unified IP Phone Buffer Overflow in Parsing DNS Responses Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0530.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified IP Phone. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted DNS response to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Phone models 7940, 7940G, 7960, and 7960G are affected when running SCCP and SIP firmware.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsj74818 and CSCsk21863 to this vulnerability.Jon Griffin and Mustaque Ahamad of the School of Computer Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0530.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0531.title: Cisco Unified IP Phone Heap Overflow in Parsing SIP Proxy Responses Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0531.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified IP Phone in the processing of responses from a SIP proxy. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote SIP proxy can send a specially crafted challenge/response message to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target device.Models 7940, 7940G, 7960 and 7960G running SIP firmware are affected.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj74765 to this vulnerability.Jon Griffin and Mustaque Ahamad of the School of Computer Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0531.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target device.

CVE-2008-0532.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server Buffer Overflow in UCP CGI Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0532.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server in the User-Changeable Password (UCP) application. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the 'CSuserCGI.exe' web service trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Cisco Secure ACS for Windows and the Cisco Secure ACS Solution Engine appliance is affected.Cisco Secure ACS for UNIX is not affected.UCP is not installed by default.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsl49180 to this vulnerability.Felix 'FX' Lindner, Recurity Labs GmbH, reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0532.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0533.title: Cisco Secure Access Control Server Input Validation Hole in UCP Pages Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0533.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control Server in the User-Changeable Password (UCP) application. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several UCP application pages do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Secure Access Control Server software (CSuserCGI.exe) and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Cisco Secure ACS for Windows and the Cisco Secure ACS Solution Engine appliance is affected.Cisco Secure ACS for UNIX is not affected.UCP is not installed by default.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsl49205 to this vulnerability.Felix 'FX' Lindner, Recurity Labs GmbH, reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0533.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Secure Access Control Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0534.title: Cisco Service Control Engine SSH Server Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0534.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Service Control Engine in the SSH server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause management access to become unavailable or cause the target device to reload.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsi68582, CSCsh49563, and CSCsm14239 to these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0534.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload or cause management access to become unavailable.

CVE-2008-0536.title: Cisco Service Control Engine SSH Server Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0536.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Service Control Engine in the SSH server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause management access to become unavailable or cause the target device to reload.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsi68582, CSCsh49563, and CSCsm14239 to these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0536.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload or cause management access to become unavailable.

CVE-2008-0539.title: BIG-IP Application Security Manager Input Validation Hole in '/dms/policy/rep_request.php' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0539.body: A vulnerability was reported in BIG-IP Application Security Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The '/dms/policy/rep_request.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'report_type' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated administrative user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the BIG-IP software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:https://[target]/dms/policy/rep_request.php?report_type=%22%3E%3Cbody+onload=alert(%26quot%3BXSS%26quot%3B)%3E%3Cfoo+nnposter reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0539.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the BIG-IP software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0552.title: eTicket Input Validation Hole in 'index.php' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0552.body: A vulnerability was reported in eTicket. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'index.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the eTicket software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A demonstration exploit URL is provided:http://[target]/index.php/"><script>alert('XSS')</script>The vendor was notified on January 21, 2008.Alessandro 'jekil' Tanasi reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.lonerunners.net/users/jekil/pub/hack-eticket/hack-eticket.txt
CVE-2008-0552.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the eTicket software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0553.title: Tcl/Tk Buffer Overflow in Processing GIF Files Lets Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0553.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tcl/Tk. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted GIF file that, when processed by the target application using Tcl/Tk, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.
CVE-2008-0553.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0554.title: Netpbm Buffer Overflow in readImageData() in 'giftopnm' May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0554.body: A vulnerability was reported in Netpbm. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted GIF file that, when loaded by the target application, will trigger a buffer overflow in the readImageData() function in 'giftopnm.c' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application using netpbm.A demonstration exploit GIF is available at:http://people.debian.org/~seanius/security/php/poc/38112.gif
CVE-2008-0554.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target application, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0555.title: Apache-SSL Certificate Processing Bug May Let Remote Users View Portions of Kernel Memory
CVE-2008-0555.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache-SSL. A remote user may be able to view portions of kernel memory.A remote user can supply a specially crafted client certificate that will trigger a flaw in ExpandCert() and cause Apache-SSL to set the client certificate environment variables incorrectly. Part of the variables may be written with portions of system memory. If the target application provides access to those variables, a remote user may be able to view portions of kernel memory.The vendor was notified on January 17, 2008.Alexander Klink of Cynops GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0555.extra: A remote user may be able to view portions of kernel memory in certain situations.

CVE-2008-0556.title: OpenCA Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2008-0556.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenCA. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The software performs actions via HTTP GET requests without validation. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by an authenticated target administrator, will cause actions on the target system to be executed by the target administrator's browser.The original advisory is available at:https://www.cynops.de/advisories/CVE-2008-0556.txtAlexander Klink of Cynops GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0556.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0573.title: SafeNet SoftRemote Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-0573.body: A vulnerability was reported in SafeNet SoftRemote in the 'IPSecDrv.sys' driver. A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke a specially crafted IOCTL to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.mu-b of digit-labs.org reported this vulnerability.The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/5004
CVE-2008-0573.extra: A local user can obtain kernel privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0578.title: Tripwire Enterprise Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0578.body: Dave Lewis of Liquidmatrix Security Digest reported a vulnerability in Tripwire Enterprise/Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web management login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Tripwire software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The original advisory is available at:http://www.liquidmatrix.org/blog/2008/01/29/advisory-tripwire-enterprise-xss-vulnerability/
CVE-2008-0578.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Tripwire software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0589.title: AIX 'ps' Command Discloses Process Environment Variables to Local Users
CVE-2008-0589.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM AIX. A local user can view process environment variables.A local user can invoke the 'ps' command to view the values of all processes environment variables.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://rawlab.mindcreations.com/codes/exp/nix/ibmaixps.shAndrea "bunker" Purificato reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0589.extra: A local user can view process environment variables.

CVE-2008-0593.title: Mozilla Firefox Stylesheet Processing Bug May Let Remote Users Obtain URL Parameters
CVE-2008-0593.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox in the processing of stylesheets. A remote user may be able to obtain potentially sensitive URL parameters.A remote web site may be able to obtain potentially sensitive URL parameters due to the way in which the browser handles stylesheets and HTTP 302 redirects.Martin Straka reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0593.extra: A remote user may be able to obtain potentially sensitive URL parameters.

CVE-2008-0595.title: D-Bus Policy Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Restricted Method Calls
CVE-2008-0595.body: A vulnerability was reported in D-Bus. A remote user can execute certain method calls.The <allow send_interface= some.interface.WithMethods /> policy statement allows a remote user to send a message without an interface to bypass policy deny rules. A remote user can connect to the dbus-daemon to execute restricted method calls.Havoc Pennington reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0595.extra: A remote user can execute restricted method calls on the target system.

CVE-2008-0596.title: CUPS Bugs in Adding/Deleting Shared Printers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0596.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS (Common UNIX Printing System). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted IPP packets to cause the target CUPS service to crash.A remote user can trigger a memory leak, causing the target daemon to consume all available memory and crash [CVE-2008-0596].A remote user can add or remove shared printers to cause the target service to dereference already freed memory and crash [CVE-2008-0597].These vulnerabilities were reported by Red Hat as affecting older versions of CUPS distributed with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
CVE-2008-0596.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2008-0597.title: CUPS Bugs in Adding/Deleting Shared Printers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-0597.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS (Common UNIX Printing System). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted IPP packets to cause the target CUPS service to crash.A remote user can trigger a memory leak, causing the target daemon to consume all available memory and crash [CVE-2008-0596].A remote user can add or remove shared printers to cause the target service to dereference already freed memory and crash [CVE-2008-0597].These vulnerabilities were reported by Red Hat as affecting older versions of CUPS distributed with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
CVE-2008-0597.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2008-0598.title: Linux Kernel copy_user() IA32 Emulation Bug Discloses Information to Local Users
CVE-2008-0598.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.The copy_user() function on linux x86_64 systems when in ia32 emulation does not properly initialize memory. A local user can exploit this to obtain potentially sensitive data from uninitialized memory.Tavis Ormandy reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0598.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2008-0600.title: Linux Kernel vmsplice() Memory Dereference Bug Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2008-0600.body: A vulnerability was reported in Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a flaw in the vmsplice_to_user() function in 'fs/splice.c' to trigger a memory dereference error and execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can also exploit a flaw in the copy_from_user_mmap_sem() function to read arbitrary kernel memory locations.Wojciech Purczynski reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0600.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-0610.title: UltraVNC vncviewer Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0610.body: A vulnerability was reported in the UltraVNC vncviewer. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target vncviewer client (when in LISTENING mode) to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.The UltraVNC server is not affected.
CVE-2008-0610.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0620.title: SAPlpd Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0620.body: Luigi Auriemma reported vulnerabilities in SAPlpd. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target line printer daemon on port 515 to trigger any of several memory corruption errors and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vulnerable utility is included in SAP GUI version 7.10.Some demonstration exploit code is available at:http://aluigi.org/poc/saplpdz.zip
CVE-2008-0620.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0621.title: SAPlpd Memory Corruption Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0621.body: Luigi Auriemma reported vulnerabilities in SAPlpd. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target line printer daemon on port 515 to trigger any of several memory corruption errors and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vulnerable utility is included in SAP GUI version 7.10.Some demonstration exploit code is available at:http://aluigi.org/poc/saplpdz.zip
CVE-2008-0621.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0623.title: Yahoo Music Jukebox Buffer Overflow in AddImage() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0623.body: A vulnerability was reported in Yahoo Music Jukebox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in an ActiveX control used by Yahoo Music Jukebox and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 5F810AFC-BB5F-4416-BE63-E01DD117BD6CA demonstration exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/5046Krystian Kloskowski (h07) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0623.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0625.title: Yahoo Music Jukebox Buffer Overflow in 'mediagrid.dll' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0625.body: A vulnerability was reported in Yahoo Music in an ActiveX control. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the AddBitmap() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 22FD7C0A-850C-4A53-9821-0B0915C96139A demonstration exploit is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/5052Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0625.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-0628.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) XML External Entity Property Lets Remote Users Access URL Resources
CVE-2008-0628.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can access URL resources or cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted XML file that, when processed by the target trusted applet, will be able to access URL resources (e.g., files, web pages) or cause denial of service conditions.This may occur even if the "external general entities" property is set to FALSE.Chris Evans and Johannes Henkel of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0628.extra: A remote user can access URL resources or cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2008-0638.title: VERITAS Storage Foundation Veritas Enterprise Administrator Heap Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0638.body: A vulnerability was reported in VERITAS Storage Foundation in the Veritas Enterprise Administrator component. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a heap overflow in the VEA administrative service and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.Remote code execution was confirmed on Windows-based systems.Sebastian Apelt reported this vulnerability via 3Com ZDI.
CVE-2008-0638.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0639.title: Novell Client NWSPOOL.DLL Stack Overflow in EnumPrinters() Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0639.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Novell Client. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a stack overflow in the EnumPrinters() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on December 11, 2007.Avosani Gabriele and an anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.The original advisory is available at:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-08-005.html
CVE-2008-0639.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0640.title: Symantec Ghost Solution Suite Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0640.body: A vulnerability was reported in Symantec Ghost Solution Suite. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.The system does not properly authenticate communications between the Ghost Console and the Ghost Management Agent. A remote user on the local network can conduct an ARP spoofing attack to impersonate a Ghost server and execute arbitrary commands on the target Ghost client. The commands will run with System privileges.Only systems that use the Ghost Console or the Ghost Management Agent are affected.Nicolas Pouvesle of Tenable Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0640.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-0642.title: RoboHelp Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0642.body: A vulnerability was reported in RoboHelp. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the RoboHelp software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Tavis Ormandy of Google reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0642.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the RoboHelp software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0643.title: Adobe ColdFusion Input Validation Hole in Some CGI Parameters Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-0643.body: A vulnerability was reported in ColdFusion 8 and ColdFusion MX 7. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied cgi parameters before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Macromedia ColdFusion software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.ColdFusion systems installed with Windows IIS 6 are affected.Millennium Communications, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-0643.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Macromedia ColdFusion software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-0656.title: EMC Documentum 'dmclTrace.jsp' Bug Lets Remote Users Upload Arbitrary Files and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-0656.body: Pablo Gaston Milano of CYBSEC reported a vulnerability in EMC Documentum Administrator and Documentum Webtop.
