CVE-2008-3021.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user with Microsoft Office, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerabilities reside in various Microsoft Office filters.A specially crafted PICT image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3018]. Shaun Colley of NGS Software reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3019].A specially crafted BMP image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3020]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A specially crafted PICT image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3021]. Damian Put reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.A specially crafted WPG image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3460]. Damian Put reported this vulnerability via iDefense.Microsoft Office Project 2002 SP1, Microsoft Office Converter Pack, and Microsoft Works 8 are also affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-3021.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3024.title: QNX Stack Overflow in phgrafx Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3024.body: A vulnerability was reported in QNX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can trigger a buffer overflow in '/usr/photon/bin/phgrafx' to execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.A specially crafted '*.pal' filename in the 'palette' directory can trigger the stack overflow.The vendor was notified on March 24, 2008.Filipe Balestra and Rodrigo Rubira Branco of Scanit R&D Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3024.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3064.title: RealPlayer Local Resource Reference Flaw Has Unspecified Impact
CVE-2008-3064.body: A vulnerability was reported in RealPlayer. The impact was not specified.The software contains a local resource reference flaw.No details were provided.RealPlayer Enterprise is also affected.

CVE-2008-3066.title: RealPlayer ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow in Import Method May Let Remote Users Execute Abitrary Code
CVE-2008-3066.body: A vulnerability was reported in RealPlayer in an ActiveX control. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will load an ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow in an import method and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.RealPlayer Enterprise is also affected.Rhapsody 4 is not affected.
CVE-2008-3066.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3103.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) JMX Function Lets Remote Users Perform Unspecified Operations
CVE-2008-3103.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) in the Java Management Extensions capability. A remote user can perform certain functions on the target system.A remote user with a Java Management Extensions (JMX) management agent client can perform unauthorized operations on a target system that is running JMX with local monitoring enabled.SDK and JRE 1.4.x and 1.3.x are not affected.
CVE-2008-3103.extra: A remote user can perform unspecified operations on the target system.

CVE-2008-3104.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) Bugs Let Remote Users Connect to Local Host Ports
CVE-2008-3104.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can bypass same-origin policy restrictions.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet that, when loaded by the target user, will be able to bypass network access restrictions and connect to certain ports on the local host.Gregory Fleischer reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3104.extra: A remote user can connect to certain ports on the local host.

CVE-2008-3105.title: Java Runtime Environment XML Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Access Resources
CVE-2008-3105.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can access resources or cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted XML data that, when processed by the target user's trusted JAX-WS client or service or an untrusted applet or application, will allow the remote user to access file URLs and web site URLs. It also allows the remote user to cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.SDK and JRE 1.4.x and 1.3.x are not affected.
CVE-2008-3105.extra: A remote user can access file and web URLs.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3106.title: Java Runtime Environment XML Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Access Resources
CVE-2008-3106.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE). A remote user can access resources or cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create specially crafted XML data that, when processed by the target user's trusted JAX-WS client or service or an untrusted applet or application, will allow the remote user to access file URLs and web site URLs. It also allows the remote user to cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.SDK and JRE 1.4.x and 1.3.x are not affected.
CVE-2008-3106.extra: A remote user can access file and web URLs.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3107.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) Virtual Machine Bug Lets Remote Users Access Files and Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3107.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) Virtual Machine. A remote user can access files on the target user's system or cause arbitrary applications on the target user's system to be executed.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or application that, when loaded by the target user, will gain access to files on the target system or execute arbitrary applications residing on the target system.Fujitsu reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3107.extra: A remote user can create an applet or application that, when loaded by the target user, will access files or execute arbitrary applications on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3108.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) Buffer Overflow in Processing Fonts Lets Remote Users Access Files and Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3108.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) in the processing of fonts. A remote user can access files on the target user's system. A remote user can cause arbitrary applications on the target user's system to be executed.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the processing of fonts to gain access to files on the target system or execute arbitrary applications residing on the target system.John Heasman of NGSSoftware reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3108.extra: A remote user can create an applet or application that, when loaded by the target user, will access files or execute arbitrary applications on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3109.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) Scripting Language Bugs Let Remote Users Access Files and Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3109.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) in the processing of scripting code. A remote user can access files on the target user's system. A remote user can cause arbitrary applications on the target user's system to be executed.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the processing of scripting language to gain access to files on the target system or execute arbitrary applications residing on the target system. The remote applet can also access information from another applet.
CVE-2008-3109.extra: A remote user can create an applet that, when loaded by the target user, will access files or execute arbitrary applications on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3110.title: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) Scripting Language Bugs Let Remote Users Access Files and Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3110.body: A vulnerability was reported in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) in the processing of scripting code. A remote user can access files on the target user's system. A remote user can cause arbitrary applications on the target user's system to be executed.A remote user can create a specially crafted applet or application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the processing of scripting language to gain access to files on the target system or execute arbitrary applications residing on the target system. The remote applet can also access information from another applet.
CVE-2008-3110.extra: A remote user can create an applet that, when loaded by the target user, will access files or execute arbitrary applications on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3111.title: Java Web Start Bugs Let Remote Users Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3111.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Java Web Start. A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and gain elevated privileges on the target user's system. This can be exploited to read and write files on the target user's system and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.Other vulnerabilities allow a remote user to create arbitrary files on the target user's system, delete arbitrary files on the target user's system, and determine the location of the Java Web Start cache.John Heasman of NGSSoftware reported one of these vulnerabilities. Peter Csepely reported one vulnerability via TippingPoint. An anonymous researcher reported one of these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-3111.extra: A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2008-3112.title: Java Web Start Bugs Let Remote Users Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3112.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Java Web Start. A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and gain elevated privileges on the target user's system. This can be exploited to read and write files on the target user's system and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.Other vulnerabilities allow a remote user to create arbitrary files on the target user's system, delete arbitrary files on the target user's system, and determine the location of the Java Web Start cache.John Heasman of NGSSoftware reported one of these vulnerabilities. Peter Csepely reported one vulnerability via TippingPoint. An anonymous researcher reported one of these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-3112.extra: A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2008-3113.title: Java Web Start Bugs Let Remote Users Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3113.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Java Web Start. A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and gain elevated privileges on the target user's system. This can be exploited to read and write files on the target user's system and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.Other vulnerabilities allow a remote user to create arbitrary files on the target user's system, delete arbitrary files on the target user's system, and determine the location of the Java Web Start cache.John Heasman of NGSSoftware reported one of these vulnerabilities. Peter Csepely reported one vulnerability via TippingPoint. An anonymous researcher reported one of these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-3113.extra: A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2008-3114.title: Java Web Start Bugs Let Remote Users Gain Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2008-3114.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Java Web Start. A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted application that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and gain elevated privileges on the target user's system. This can be exploited to read and write files on the target user's system and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.Other vulnerabilities allow a remote user to create arbitrary files on the target user's system, delete arbitrary files on the target user's system, and determine the location of the Java Web Start cache.John Heasman of NGSSoftware reported one of these vulnerabilities. Peter Csepely reported one vulnerability via TippingPoint. An anonymous researcher reported one of these vulnerabilities via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-3114.extra: A remote user can read, write, and delete files and execute applications on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.

CVE-2008-3128.title: Pivot Input Validation Flaw in 't' Parameter Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory
CVE-2008-3128.body: A vulnerability was reported in Pivot. A remote user can view files on the target system.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 't' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system.The original advisory is available at:http://milw0rm.com/exploits/5973Nine:Situations:Group::bookoo reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3128.extra: A remote user can view files on the target system.

CVE-2008-3134.title: GraphicsMagick Bugs in Multiple Readers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3134.body: A vulnerability was reported in GraphicsMagick. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target application, will cause the target application to crash.The AVI, AVS, DCM, EPT, FITS, MTV, PALM, RLA, and TGA readers are affected. The GetImageCharacteristics() is affected.
CVE-2008-3134.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when processed by the target application, will cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-3137.title: Wireshark GSM SMS, PANA, KISMET, RTMPT, and syslog Dissector Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3137.body: A vulnerability was reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions or obtain system memory contents.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.The GSM SMS dissector is affected on versions 0.99.2 through 1.0.0.The PANA and KISMET dissectors are affected on versions 0.99.3 through 1.0.0.The RTMPT dissector is affected on versions 0.99.8 through 1.0.0.The syslog dissector is affected in version 1.0.0.A user can cause the RMI dissector to disclose system memory on versions 0.9.5 through 1.0.0.Noam Rathaus reported the RMI dissector vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3137.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to crash.A user may be able to obtain portions of system memory contents.

CVE-2008-3138.title: Wireshark GSM SMS, PANA, KISMET, RTMPT, and syslog Dissector Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3138.body: A vulnerability was reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions or obtain system memory contents.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.The GSM SMS dissector is affected on versions 0.99.2 through 1.0.0.The PANA and KISMET dissectors are affected on versions 0.99.3 through 1.0.0.The RTMPT dissector is affected on versions 0.99.8 through 1.0.0.The syslog dissector is affected in version 1.0.0.A user can cause the RMI dissector to disclose system memory on versions 0.9.5 through 1.0.0.Noam Rathaus reported the RMI dissector vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3138.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to crash.A user may be able to obtain portions of system memory contents.

CVE-2008-3139.title: Wireshark GSM SMS, PANA, KISMET, RTMPT, and syslog Dissector Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3139.body: A vulnerability was reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions or obtain system memory contents.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.The GSM SMS dissector is affected on versions 0.99.2 through 1.0.0.The PANA and KISMET dissectors are affected on versions 0.99.3 through 1.0.0.The RTMPT dissector is affected on versions 0.99.8 through 1.0.0.The syslog dissector is affected in version 1.0.0.A user can cause the RMI dissector to disclose system memory on versions 0.9.5 through 1.0.0.Noam Rathaus reported the RMI dissector vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3139.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to crash.A user may be able to obtain portions of system memory contents.

CVE-2008-3141.title: Wireshark GSM SMS, PANA, KISMET, RTMPT, and syslog Dissector Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3141.body: A vulnerability was reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions or obtain system memory contents.A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.The GSM SMS dissector is affected on versions 0.99.2 through 1.0.0.The PANA and KISMET dissectors are affected on versions 0.99.3 through 1.0.0.The RTMPT dissector is affected on versions 0.99.8 through 1.0.0.The syslog dissector is affected in version 1.0.0.A user can cause the RMI dissector to disclose system memory on versions 0.9.5 through 1.0.0.Noam Rathaus reported the RMI dissector vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3141.extra: A remote user can cause Wireshark to crash.A user may be able to obtain portions of system memory contents.

CVE-2008-3145.title: Wireshark Packet Reassembly Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3145.body: A vulnerability was reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a series of specially crafted packets to cause the target service to crash.The vulnerability resides in the fragment_add_work() function in 'reassemble.c'.
CVE-2008-3145.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2008-3146.title: Wireshark NCP Dissector and zlib Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3146.body: A vulnerability was reported in Wireshark. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted NCP data to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target service to crash or enter an infinite loop.A remote user can also send a specially crafted zlib-compressed packet to cause the target service to crash.A user can create a specially crafted Tektronix .rf5 file that, when loaded, will cause Wireshark to crash.
CVE-2008-3146.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2008-3155.title: Panda ActiveScan Update Function Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Install CAB Files
CVE-2008-3155.body: A vulnerability was reported in Panda ActiveScan in the update function. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can also cause arbitrary CAB files to be installed on the target user's system.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 41524153-46FB-488C-8E53-7624AB83C46FA demonstration exploit is available at:http://karol.wiesek.pl/files/panda.tgzKarol Wiesek reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3155.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3156.title: Panda ActiveScan Update Function Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Install CAB Files
CVE-2008-3156.body: A vulnerability was reported in Panda ActiveScan in the update function. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can also cause arbitrary CAB files to be installed on the target user's system.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 41524153-46FB-488C-8E53-7624AB83C46FA demonstration exploit is available at:http://karol.wiesek.pl/files/panda.tgzKarol Wiesek reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3156.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3157.title: Nortel SIP Multimedia PC Client Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3157.body: A vulnerability was reported in Nortel SIP Multimedia PC Client. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.The client does not limit the number of connections or active windows. A remote user can create a large number of sessions to exhaust resources on the target client.VoIPshield reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=61
CVE-2008-3157.extra: A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system.

CVE-2008-3158.title: Novell Client Unspecified Bug in NWFS.SYS Has Unspecified Impact
CVE-2008-3158.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell Client. The impact was not specified.The vulnerability resides in NWFS.SYS. No details were provided.Ruben Santamarta reported this vulnerability.

CVE-2008-3159.title: Novell eDirectory Integer Overflow in 'ds.dlm' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3159.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell eDirectory. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can connect to TCP port 524 and send specially crafted data to trigger an integer overflow in 'ds.dlm' and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor was notified on December 4, 2007.Sebastian Apelt reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-3159.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-3170.title: Safari Bug in Setting Cookies in Certain Domains May Let Remote Users Conduct Session Fixation Attacks
CVE-2008-3170.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user may be able to set cookies on certain domains as part of a session fixation attack.A remote user can set a cookie on the target user's browser for certain country specific top-level domains (TLDs) to cause Safari to send the cookies when connecting to any other web servers in the same domain.This flaw may allow remote users to conduct session fixation attacks to hijack a target user's session.The original advisory is available at:http://kuza55.blogspot.com/2008/07/some-random-safari-notes.htmlAlex (kuza55) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3170.extra: A remote user may be able to set cookies in certain top-level domains to be sent by the target user's browser when connecting to any server in that domain.

CVE-2008-3175.title: CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops Integer Overflow in LGServer Service May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3175.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the LGServer service on TCP port 1900 to trigger an integer underoverflow and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The following product versions are affected:CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops r11.5CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops r11.1 SP2CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops r11.1 SP1CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops r11.1CA ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops r11.0CA Desktop Management Suite 11.2CA Desktop Management Suite 11.1CA Protection Suites r2CA Protection Suites 3.0CA Protection Suites 3.1Only the server installation of BrightStor ARCserve Backup for Laptops and Desktops is affected. The client installation is not affected.The vendor was notified on May 30, 2008.The Vulnerability Research Team, Assurent Secure Technologies, a TELUS company reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3175.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-3231.title: xine-lib Bugs in Processing Media Files Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3231.body: A vulnerability was reported in xine-lib. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a file with a specially crafted ID3 value that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Real file may also be able to trigger a buffer overflow in the Real demuxer.A remote user can create specially crafted media files (e.g., Ogg format) that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a crash [CVE-2008-3231].
CVE-2008-3231.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target player to crash.

CVE-2008-3244.title: F-Prot Antivirus CHM Parsing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3244.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Prot Antivirus. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted CHM file to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access error and cause the target service to crash.The vendor was notified on January 22, 2008.Sergio Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3244.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2008-3246.title: BlackBerry Enterprise Server Bug in PDF Distiller Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3246.body: A vulnerability was reported in BlackBerry Enterprise Server in the BlackBerry Attachment Service. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted PDF file via e-mail that, when viewed by a user, will trigger a flaw in the PDF distiller and execute arbitrary code on the system running the BlackBerry Attachment Service.BlackBerry Unite! versions prior to 1.0 SP1 (1.0.1) bundle 36 are also affected.
CVE-2008-3246.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-3247.title: Linux Kernel x86_64 LDT Buffer Overflow May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3247.body: A vulnerability was reported in Linux Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions and may be able to obtain elevated privileges.A local user can trigger a Local Descriptor Table buffer overflow on x86_64 systems to potentially execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges.
CVE-2008-3247.extra: A local user may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges.A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2008-3248.title: VERITAS File System (VxFS) Discloses Potentially Sensitive Information to Local Users
CVE-2008-3248.body: A vulnerability was reported in VERITAS File System (VxFS). A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can exploit flaws in two commands that are part of the Quick I/O for Database feature.A local user can invoke the qiomkfile command to view the contents of uninitialized file system blocks.A local user can invoke the qioadmin command to redirect the contents of arbitrary files to standard error.Derek Callaway of Security Objectives reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3248.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2008-3253.title: Citrix XenServer Input Validation Flaw in XenAPI HTTP Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3253.body: A vulnerability was reported in Citrix XenServer. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The XenAPI HTTP interfaces does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Citrix XenServer software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Versions 4.0 and prior versions are not affected.TEPCO from Japan reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3253.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Citrix XenServer software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3257.title: Oracle WebLogic Apache Connector Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3257.body: A vulnerability was reported in Oracle WebLogic in the Apache Connector. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP POST request to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vulnerability resides in mod_weblogic.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/6089KingCope reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3257.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-3259.title: OpenSSH on HP-UX Lets Local Users Hijack X11 Sessions
CVE-2008-3259.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system on certain operating systems.When X11UseLocalhost is disabled, a local user may be able to bind to the OpenSSH X11 forwarding port and hijack an X11 session.Modern BSD-based operating systems, Linux, OS X, and Solaris are not affected.sway2004009 AT hotmail.com reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3259.extra: A local user can hijack X11 sessions.

CVE-2008-3263.title: Asterisk IAX2 Poke Packet Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3263.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a flood of specially crafted IAX2 POKE requests to consume all available IAX2 protocol call numbers on the target system, preventing other IAX2 calls from getting through.The vendor was notified on July 18, 2008.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://downloads.securityfocus.com/vulnerabilities/exploits/30321.plJeremy McNamara reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3263.extra: A remote user can consume all available IAX2 call numbers on the target system, preventing additional calls.

CVE-2008-3264.title: Asterisk Firmware Update Protocol Lets Remote Users Attack Arbitrary Sites Via the Asterisk Server
CVE-2008-3264.body: A vulnerability was reported in Asterisk. A remote user can initiate denial of service attacks via the target system.A remote user can send a spoofed IAX2 PWDOWNL request to the target system to cause the target system to respond to the spoofed system. A 40 byte PWDOWNL request can result in a 1040 byte response. This can be exploited by a remote user to attack arbitrary systems via the target system.The vendor was notified on July 18, 2008.Tilghman Lesher reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3264.extra: A remote user can attack arbitrary systems via the target system.

CVE-2008-3270.title: yum-rhn-plugin Certificate Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks to Prevent Updates
CVE-2008-3270.body: A vulnerability was reported in yum-rhn-plugin. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack.The software does not verify the server's SSL certificate for all communications between the plugin and the Red Hat Network server. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can provide malicious repository metadata to the target plugin to prevent the plugin from receiving specific security updates.
CVE-2008-3270.extra: A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can prevent the plugin from receiving specific security updates.

CVE-2008-3271.title: Tomcat May Let Remote Users Access Restricted Contexts
CVE-2008-3271.body: A vulnerability was reported in Tomcat. A remote user may be able to access a restricted context.A remote user from a non-permitted IP address may be able to gain access to a context protected with a valve that extends the RemoteFilterValve setting.Kenichi Tsukamoto of Fujitsu reported this vulnerability via JPCERT.
CVE-2008-3271.extra: A remote user may be able to access a restricted context.

CVE-2008-3272.title: Linux Kernel snd_seq_oss_synth_make_info() Discloses Kernel Memory Information to Local Users
CVE-2008-3272.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can obtain information from kernel memory.The snd_seq_oss_synth_make_info() function does not validate the user-supplied device number before returning information to the calling user. A local user may be able to obtain information from kernel memory.Tobias Klein reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3272.extra: A local user can obtain information from kernel memory.

CVE-2008-3273.title: JBoss Input Validation Hole in JavaServer Faces Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Access Control Bug in Status Servlet Lets Remote Users Obtain Information
CVE-2008-3273.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in JBoss. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can determine information about deployed web contexts.The JavaServer Faces (JSF) component does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2008-1285]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the JBoss software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can access the status servlet to obtain information about deployed web contexts [CVE-2008-3273].
CVE-2008-3273.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the JBoss software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can determine details about deployed web contexts on the target system.

CVE-2008-3274.title: Red Hat Enterprise IPA Installation Procedure Lets Remote Users Retrieve the Master Kerberos Password
CVE-2008-3274.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat Enterprise IPA. A remote user can obtain passwords.The installation procedure places the master Kerberos password in the LDAP server in a manner that allows a remote user to retrieve the password via LDAP.
CVE-2008-3274.extra: A remote user can obtain the master Kerberos password.

CVE-2008-3276.title: Linux Kernel Integer Overflow in dccp_setsockopt_change() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3276.body: A vulnerability was reported in Linux Kernel. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted DCCP data to trigger an integer overflow and cause a kernel panic on the target system.The vulnerability resides in 'net/dccp/proto.c'.Eugene Teo reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3276.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-3281.title: Libxml2 Recursive Entity Evaluation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3281.body: A vulnerability was reported in Libxml2. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted XML document that, when processed by the target application using libxml2, will cause the application to consume excessive memory and CPU resources on the target system.Andreas Solberg reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3281.extra: A remote user can create an XML document that, when processed by the target application, will consume excessive memory and CPU resources on the target system.

CVE-2008-3282.title: OpenOffice 64-bit Memory Allocation Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3282.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a numeric truncation error in the memory allocator and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Some 64-bit systems are affected.The vulnerability resides in 'sal/rtl/source/alloc_global.c'.Chris Evans of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://scary.beasts.org/security/CESA-2008-006.html
CVE-2008-3282.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3283.title: Red Hat Directory Server Memory Leaks Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3283.body: A vulnerability was reported in Red Hat Directory Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a memory leak and cause the target service to consume excessive memory resources.
CVE-2008-3283.extra: A remote user can cause excessive memory consumption on the target system.

CVE-2008-3288.title: Retrospect Weak Password Hashing Algorithm Lets Users Obtain the Password
CVE-2008-3288.body: A vulnerability was reported in Retrospect. A user can determine the target password.The system uses a weak password hashing algorithm. A user with access to the hashed password can determine the original password.The vendor was notified on April 20, 2008.Zhenhua Liu of Fortinet's FortiGuard Global Security Research Team reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.fortiguardcenter.com/advisory/FGA-2008-16.html
CVE-2008-3288.extra: A user can determine the password.

CVE-2008-3330.title: Horde Application Framework Input Validation Hole in Contact Names Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3330.body: A vulnerability was reported in Horde Application Framework. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user with the ability to create a contact can create a contact with a specially crafted name that, when viewed by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Horde Application Framework software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vulnerability resides in 'services/obrowser/index.php'.
CVE-2008-3330.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Horde Application Framework software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3330.title: Turba Input Validation Hole in Contact Names Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3330.body: A vulnerability was reported in Turba. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user with the ability to create a contact can create a contact with a specially crafted name that, when viewed by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Horde Turba software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2008-3330.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Turba software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3356.title: Ingres Database 'verifydb' Utility Lets Local Users Modify Files
CVE-2008-3356.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ingres Database. A local user can modify certain files on the target system.A local user can invoke the 'verifydb' utility to modify files on the target system with 'ingres' user privileges.The 'verifydb' utility creates the 'iivdb.log' file with world-writable permissions in the current directory. A local user can create a symbolic link from a file on the target system to the log file to gain write access to the target file.The vendor was notified on July 20, 2007.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-3356.extra: A local user can modify files on the target system with 'ingres' user privileges.

CVE-2008-3358.title: SAP NetWeaver Unspecified Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3358.body: A vulnerability was reported in SAP NetWeaver. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the SAP NetWeaver software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Some browsers may not permit code execution.The vendor was notified on July 21, 2008.Martin Suess reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3358.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the SAP NetWeaver software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3360.title: IntelliTamper Buffer Overflow in Scanning Long URLs Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3360.body: A vulnerability was reported in IntelliTamper. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when scanned by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Joan Calvet of TECHNAPOL reported this vulnerability via FrSIRT.
CVE-2008-3360.extra: A remote user can create a URL that, when scanned by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3364.title: Trend Micro OfficeScan Buffer Overflow in ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3364.body: A vulnerability was reported in Trend Micro OfficeScan. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow in the objRemoveCtrl control and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 5EFE8CB1-D095-11D1-88FC-0080C859833BThe vendor notes that Trend Micro Worry-Free Business Security (WFBS) version 5.0 and Trend Micro Client Server Messaging Security (CSM) versions 3.5 and 3.6 are also affected.Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3364.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3370.title: EMC Centera Universal Access Input Validation Flaw in Login Module Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2008-3370.body: Lars Heidelberg and Aaron Brown of adMERITia reported a vulnerability in EMC Centera Universal Access. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The CUA Module Login does not properly validate user-supplied input in the user name field. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.A remote user can exploit this to bypass authentication.The vendor was notified on May 20, 2008.
CVE-2008-3370.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2008-3373.title: AVG Anti-Virus UPX File Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3373.body: A vulnerability was reported in AVG Anti-Virus. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted UPX file that, when processed by the target application, will cause the application to crash.The vendor was notified on July 10, 2008.Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3373.extra: A remote user can cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-3389.title: Ingres Database Buffer Overflow in 'libbecompat' Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3389.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ingres Database. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can set a specially crafted environment variable to trigger a stack overflow in 'libbecompat' and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with 'ingres' user privileges.The vendor was notified on July 20, 2007.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-3389.extra: A local user can obtain 'ingres' user privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3421.title: Blackboard Academic Suite Input Validation Flaws Permit Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2008-3421.body: A vulnerability was reported in Blackboard Academic Suite. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied requests. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will submit arbitrary data to the target site and take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'update_module.jsp', 'enroll_course.pl', and 'unenroll.jsp' scripts are affected. Other scripts may also be affected.The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:http://ceaseless.ws/bb-csrf/Mark Janssen reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3421.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary data to be submitted to the target site to take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3423.title: IBM WebSphere Portal Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
CVE-2008-3423.body: A vulnerability was reported in IBM WebSphere Portal. A remote user can bypass authentication.A remote user can exploit an unspecified flaw in the Authorization/Authentication (login/logout) module to gain administrative access to the target application.
CVE-2008-3423.extra: A remote user can gain administrative access on the target application.

CVE-2008-3424.title: Condor Authorization List Bug May Let Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
CVE-2008-3424.body: A vulnerability was reported in Condor. A remote user may be able to bypass access controls.The software does not properly process wild card characters in authorization lists. If the system has a configuration variable that specifies the policy and contains the wild card asterisk character, a user may be able to access the system.Affected variables include ALLOW_WRITE, DENY_WRITE, HOSTALLOW_WRITE, and HOSTDENY_WRITE.
CVE-2008-3424.extra: A remote user may be able to bypass access controls and access the target system.

CVE-2008-3425.title: Sun N1 Service Provisioning System Administration Console Grants Access to Managed Sun Java System Web Server Systems
CVE-2008-3425.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun N1 Service Provisioning System in the Sun Java System Web Server 7.0 plugin. Certain users can gain access to Sun Java System Web Server systems.A user on the administration console of the Sun N1 Service Provisioning System (N1SPS) can view the password for and gain administrator access to Sun Java System Web Servers that are being maintained by the N1SPS.
CVE-2008-3425.extra: A user on the N1SPS administration console can gain administrator access on Sun Java System Web Servers that are being maintained by the N1SPS.

CVE-2008-3431.title: Sun xVM VirtualBox Lets Local Users Gain Full Privileges
CVE-2008-3431.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun xVM VirtualBox. A local user on the guest OS can obtain full privileges on the target host system.A local user on the guest operating system can exploit an input validation flaw in 'VBoxDrv.sys' to execute arbitrary code on the target host operating system with kernel-level privileges.Specially crafted IOCTLs issued via the '\\.\VBoxDrv' device with a buffering mode of METHOD_NEITHER can trigger this vulnerability.The vendor was notified on July 16, 2008.Anibal Sacco from the CORE IMPACT Exploit Writing Team (EWT) at Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.coresecurity.com/content/virtualbox-privilege-escalation-vulnerability
CVE-2008-3431.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can obtain kernel-level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3437.title: OpenOffice Update Component Lack of Digital Signatures Lets Remote Users Install Arbitrary Code in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-3437.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenOffice. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.The update software does not digitally sign and verify software updates. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can cause arbitrary code to be installed on the target user's system when the target user's OpenOffice update utility performs an update.A remote user can conduct DNS spoofing attacks, man-in-the-middle attacks, or other methods to potentially masquerade as the update server.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.infobyte.com.ar/developments.htmlFrancisco Amato of Infobyte Security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3437.extra: A remote user with the ability to spoof the DNS or conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3440.title: Sun Java Update Component Lack of Digital Signatures Lets Remote Users Install Arbitrary Code in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-3440.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Java. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.The update software does not digitally sign and verify software updates. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can cause arbitrary code to be installed on the target user's system when the target user's Java update utility performs an update.A remote user can conduct DNS spoofing attacks, man-in-the-middle attacks, or other methods to potentially masquerade as the update server.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.infobyte.com.ar/developments.htmlFrancisco Amato of Infobyte Security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3440.extra: A remote user with the ability to spoof the DNS or conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3441.title: Winamp Update Component Lack of Digital Signatures Lets Remote Users Install Arbitrary Code in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-3441.body: A vulnerability was reported in Winamp. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.The update software does not digitally sign and verify software updates. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can cause arbitrary code to be installed on the target user's system when the target user's Winamp update utility performs an update.A remote user can conduct DNS spoofing attacks, man-in-the-middle attacks, or other methods to potentially masquerade as the update server.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.infobyte.com.ar/developments.htmlFrancisco Amato of Infobyte Security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3441.extra: A remote user with the ability to spoof the DNS or conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3442.title: WinZip Update Component Lack of Digital Signatures Lets Remote Users Install Arbitrary Code in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-3442.body: A vulnerability was reported in WinZip. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.The update software does not digitally sign and verify software updates. A remote user with the ability to masquerade as the update server can cause arbitrary code to be installed on the target user's system when the target user's WinZip update utility performs an update.A remote user can conduct DNS spoofing attacks, man-in-the-middle attacks, or other methods to potentially masquerade as the update server.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.infobyte.com.ar/developments.htmlFrancisco Amato of Infobyte Security Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3442.extra: A remote user with the ability to spoof the DNS or conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can install arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3443.title: Ruby 'regex.c' Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3443.body: A vulnerability was reported in Ruby. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted requests to trigger a memory leak in the regex engine and cause the target service to enter an infinite loop and then crash.The vulnerability resides in 'regex.c'.A demonstration exploit is available at:http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/6239Laurent Gaffie reported this vulnerability in August 2008.
CVE-2008-3443.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2008-3447.title: F-Prot Antivirus Attachment Scanning Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3447.body: A vulnerability was reported in F-Prot Antivirus. A remote or local user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted file that, when scanned by F-Prot on the target user's system, will cause the target scanner to enter an infinite loop.Knud Erik Hojgaard reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3447.extra: A remote or local user can cause the target scanner to enter an infinite loop and fail to scan any additional files.

CVE-2008-3449.title: MailEnable IMAP Service Can Be Crashed With Multiple Connections to the Same Folder
CVE-2008-3449.body: A vulnerability was reported in MailEnable. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can make multiple connections to the same folders to potentially cause the target IMAP service to crash.
CVE-2008-3449.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2008-3450.title: Solaris namefs Kernel Module Bug Lets Local Users Gain Kernel Privileges or Deny Service
CVE-2008-3450.body: A vulnerability was reported in Solaris. A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can exploit a flaw in the namefs kernel module to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges or cause a kernel panic.
CVE-2008-3450.extra: A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can cause a kernel panic.

CVE-2008-3460.title: Microsoft Office Format Filter Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3460.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user with Microsoft Office, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerabilities reside in various Microsoft Office filters.A specially crafted PICT image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3018]. Shaun Colley of NGS Software reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted Encapsulated PostScript (EPS) file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3019].A specially crafted BMP image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3020]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A specially crafted PICT image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3021]. Damian Put reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.A specially crafted WPG image file can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3460]. Damian Put reported this vulnerability via iDefense.Microsoft Office Project 2002 SP1, Microsoft Office Converter Pack, and Microsoft Works 8 are also affected by these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-3460.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3464.title: Microsoft Ancillary Function Driver 'afd.sys' Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3464.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows 2003 and XP Microsoft Ancillary Function Driver. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke the Ancillary Function Driver (afd.sys) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.Fabien Le Mentec of SkyRecon reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3464.extra: A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3465.title: Microsoft GDI Buffer Overflows in Processing WMF Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3465.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft GDI. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Windows Metafile (WMF) image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted header can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2008-2249].A specially crafted file size parameter can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2008-3465].Jun Mao of VeriSign iDefense Labs reported this integer overflow vulnerability. Juan Caballero working with the Bitblaze group at Carnegie Mellon University and UC Berkeley reported the heap overflow vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3465.extra: A remote user can create a WMF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3466.title: Microsoft Host Integration Server RPC Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3466.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Host Integration Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted RPC request to the SNA RPC service to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The UUID of the affected RPC service is: ed6ee250-e0d1-11cf-925a-00aa00c006c1The vendor was notified on May 27, 2008.Stephen Fewer of Harmony Security reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-3466.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-3471.title: Microsoft Excel Object, Calendar, and Formula Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3471.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An Excel file with a specially crafted object can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3471].An Excel file in a VBA Performance Cache that contains a specially crafted calendar object can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3477].An Excel file with a specially crafted formula embedded inside a cell can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-4019].Wushi via TippingPoint, Lionel d'Hauenens of Labo Skopia via iDefense, and Joshua J. Drake of iDefense reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-3471.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3472.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Flaws Permit Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks and Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3472.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks. A remote user can determine the installation path.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.On IE 6 SP1 running on Windows 2000 SP4, a specially crafted HTML element can trigger arbitrary script execution in an arbitrary domain [CVE-2008-3472].On IE 6 SP1 running on Windows 2000 SP4, a specially crafted HTML object event can trigger arbitrary script execution in an arbitrary domain [CVE-2008-3473].Specially crafted HTML can trigger arbitrary script execution in an arbitrary domain [CVE-2008-3474]. The code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Specially crafted HTML can cause the target user's browser to access an object that has not been initialized or has been deleted, resulting in arbitrary script execution [CVE-2008-3475].Specially crafted HTML can trigger a memory corruption error, resulting in arbitrary script execution [CVE-2008-3476].David Bloom, Gregory Rubin, Ivan Fratric via TippingPoint, Thierry Zoller of n.runs, and Lee Dagon of Composica reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-3472.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary scripting code on the target user's system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with arbitrary sites, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Specially crafted HTML can cause the target user's browser to access an object that has not been initialized or has been deleted, resulting in arbitrary script execution [CVE-2008-3475].Specially crafted HTML can trigger a memory corruption error, resulting in arbitrary script execution [CVE-2008-3476].David Bloom, Gregory Rubin, Ivan Fratric via TippingPoint, Thierry Zoller of n.runs, and Lee Dagon of Composica reported these vulnerabilities.
