CVE-2008-3477.title: Microsoft Excel Object, Calendar, and Formula Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3477.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An Excel file with a specially crafted object can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3471].An Excel file in a VBA Performance Cache that contains a specially crafted calendar object can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-3477].An Excel file with a specially crafted formula embedded inside a cell can trigger code execution [CVE-2008-4019].Wushi via TippingPoint, Lionel d'Hauenens of Labo Skopia via iDefense, and Joshua J. Drake of iDefense reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-3477.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3479.title: Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) Heap Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3479.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted RPC request to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with System privileges.Windows 2000 systems that have Message Queuing Service (MSMQ) enabled are affected.TippingPoint reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3479.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with System level privileges.

CVE-2008-3488.title: Novell iManager Bug Lets Users Delete Certain Property Book Pages
CVE-2008-3488.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell iManager. A user can cause denial of service conditions.A user can delete Property Book Pages that were deleted using Plug-in Studio.
CVE-2008-3488.extra: A user can delete Property Book Pages that were created using Plug-in Studio.

CVE-2008-3501.title: Novell GroupWise Input Validation Hole in the WebAccess Simple Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3501.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell GroupWise. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The WebAccess simple interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the GroupWise software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The standard WebAccess user interface is not affected.
CVE-2008-3501.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the GroupWise software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3514.title: VMware VirtualCenter Discloses Usernames to Remote Users
CVE-2008-3514.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware VirtualCenter. A remote user can determine valid user account names.No details were provided.Brett Moore of Insomnia Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3514.extra: A remote user can determine valid account names on the target system.

CVE-2008-3515.title: Adobe Presenter Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3515.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Presenter. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Code generated by Adobe Presenter does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the code generated by Adobe Presenter and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'viewer.swf' and 'loadflash.js' files are affected.Adi Sharabani, Ayal Yogev, and Yuval Baror from IBM Rational Application Security and Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3515.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the code generated by Adobe Presenter, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3516.title: Adobe Presenter Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3516.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Presenter. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.Code generated by Adobe Presenter does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the code generated by Adobe Presenter and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The 'viewer.swf' and 'loadflash.js' files are affected.Adi Sharabani, Ayal Yogev, and Yuval Baror from IBM Rational Application Security and Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3516.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the code generated by Adobe Presenter, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3525.title: Linux Kernel SBNI WAN Driver Privilege Check Bugs May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3525.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The SIOCDEVRESINSTATS, SIOCDEVSHWSTATE, SIOCDEVENSLAVE, and SIOCDEVEMANSIPATE IOCTL requests do not properly check the user's privileges. A local user may be able to bypass security restrictions.The vulnerability resides in the sbni_ioctl() function in 'drivers/net/wan/sbni.c.'The original advisory is available at:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2008/08/29/2Eugene Teo reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3525.extra: A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3527.title: Linux Kernel Virtual Dynamic Shared Objects Boundary Error May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3527.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions. A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The Virtual Dynamic Shared Objects (vDSO) implementation does not properly check the bounds of user-supplied data.Tavis Ormandy reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3527.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A local user may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3529.title: Libxml2 Heap Overflow in xmlParseAttValueComplex() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3529.body: A vulnerability was reported in Libxml2. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted XML entity name that, when processed by the target application using libxml2, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.The vulnerability resides in the xmlParseAttValueComplex() function in 'parser.c'.
CVE-2008-3529.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-3530.title: FreeBSD ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3530.body: A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD kernel's IPv6 stack. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMPv6 'Packet Too Big Message' to trigger a kernel panic.Systems configured to process IPv6 packets that have active IPv6 TCP sockets are affected.Tom Parker and Bjoern A. Zeeb reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3530.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-3530.title: NetBSD ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3530.body: A vulnerability was reported in the NetBSD kernel's IPv6 stack. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMPv6 'Packet Too Big Message' to trigger a kernel panic.Systems configured to process IPv6 packets that have active IPv6 TCP sockets are affected.Tom Parker and Bjoern A. Zeeb reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3530.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-3531.title: FreeBSD nmount(2) Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3531.body: A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD nmount(2) system call. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.If the system is configured to allow unprivileged local users to mount file systems, a local user can invoke nmount(2) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges.James Gritton reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3531.extra: A local user can obtain kernel level privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3539.title: HP OpenView Select Identity Connectors Have an Unspecified Flaw That Lets Local Users Obtain Information
CVE-2008-3539.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP OpenView Select Identity. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.Several HP OpenView Select Identity connectors are affected.Only Windows-based systems are affected.No details were provided.The following product versions are affected:HPSI Active Directory Connector v 1.70.003 and earlierHPSI Active Directory Connector v 2.10.002 and earlierHPSI Active Directory Connector v 2.20.xxx and v2.30.xxx and earlierHPSI SunOne Connector v 1.14 and earlierHPSI eDirectory Connector v 1.12 and earlierHPSI eTrust Connector v 1.02 and earlierHPSI OID Connector v 1.02 and earlierHPSI IBM Tivoli Dir Connector v 1.02 and earlierHPSI TOPSecret Connector v 2.22.001 and earlierHPSI RACF Connector v 1.12.001 and earlierHPSI ACF2 Connector v 1.02 and earlierHPSI OpenLDAP Connector v 1.02 and earlierHPSI BiDir DirX Connector v 1.00.003 and earlier
CVE-2008-3539.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

CVE-2008-3542.title: HP Insight Diagnostics Unspecified Bug Lets Remote Users Access Files
CVE-2008-3542.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Insight Diagnostics. A remote user can gain access to files.No details were provided.
CVE-2008-3542.extra: A remote user can access files on the target system.

CVE-2008-3546.title: GIT Buffer Overflow in diff_addremove() and diff_change() May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3546.body: A vulnerability was reported in GIT. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a repository with a specially crafted pathname that is longer than PATH_MAX on the target user's system. Then, when the target user runs git-diff on the repository, a buffer overflow may occur in in diff_addremove() and diff_change(), executing arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2008-3546.extra: A remote user can create a pathname that, when processed by the target user with git-diff, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3549.title: Solaris Bug in pthread_mutex_reltimedlock_np() Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3549.body: A vulnerability was reported in Solaris. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can invoke the pthread_mutex_reltimedlock_np(3C) API to cause the system to hang or to trigger a system panic.
CVE-2008-3549.extra: A local user can cause the target system to hang or panic.

CVE-2008-3550.title: Rational ClearQuest Input Validation Hole in CQWeb Login Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-3550.body: A vulnerability was reported in Rational ClearQuest. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The CQWeb login page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'username' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Rational ClearQuest software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.[Editor's note: It is unclear if this vulnerability is related to the previously reported username parameter cross-site scripting flaw (CVE-2007-4592; Alert ID 1019685).]
CVE-2008-3550.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Rational ClearQuest software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3558.title: Webex Meeting Manager Buffer Overflow in ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3558.body: A vulnerability was reported in Webex Meeting Manager. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke an ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow in the 'atucfobj' module to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 32E26FD9-F435-4A20-A561-35D4B987CFDCThe vendor was notified on June 20, 2008.Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3558.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3584.title: NetBSD PPPoE Discovery Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3584.body: A vulnerability was reported in NetBSD. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted PPPoE discovery packet to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the kernel to crash.The system may be affected even if there are no active pppoe(4) interfaces if at least one interface has been created with "ifconfig pppoe0 create".The report indicates that it is unclear if this flaw can be exploited to trigger code execution.Yasuoka Masahiko from Internet Initiative Japan Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3584.extra: A remote user on the local network can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-3605.title: McAfee Encrypted USB Manager Bug Lets Users Conduct Password Guessing Attacks
CVE-2008-3605.body: A vulnerability was reported in McAfee Encrypted USB Manager. A user can conduct an off-line password guessing attack.When the password "Re-use Threshold" policy is set to a non-zero value, a user can conduct an off-line password guessing attack.
CVE-2008-3605.extra: A user can conduct an off-line password guessing attack.

CVE-2008-3606.title: WinGate IMAP Service Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3606.body: A vulnerability was reported in WinGate. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted LIST command to cause the target service to prevent additional IMAP connections.A demonstration exploit is provided:A01 LOGIN <user> <password>A02 LIST Ax1000 *The vendor has been notified.Joao Antunes reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3606.extra: A remote authenticated user can prevent the target IMAP service from accepting IMAP connections.

CVE-2008-3608.title: Mac OS X ImageIO TIFF and JPEG Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3608.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X ImageIO. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted TIFF or JPEG file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Robert Swiecki of Google Security Team reported the TIFF file vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3608.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3609.title: Mac OS X Kernel Credential Caching Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3609.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The system does not properly flush cached credentials when a vnode is recycled. A local user can access files without having the necessary privileges.Nevin ":-)" Liber, Thomas Pelaia of Oak Ridge National Lab, Thomas Tempelmann, and Ram Kolli reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3609.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3610.title: Mac OS X Login Window Password Change Bug Lets Local User Access the System
CVE-2008-3610.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Login Window. A local user can obtain access to the target system.A user with access to the login window can exploit a race condition to gain access without providing a password [CVE-2008-3610]. Systems with the Guest account enabled or another account set up with no password are affected. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.On systems configured to enforce policies on login passwords, when a user is required to change their password and the password change fails, the current password may not be cleared. A user with access to the login window may be able to change a user's password [CVE-2008-3611]. Version 10.5 and later versions are not affected. Christopher A. Grande of Middlesex Community College reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3610.extra: A local user can access the target system.

CVE-2008-3611.title: Mac OS X Login Window Password Change Bug Lets Local User Access the System
CVE-2008-3611.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Login Window. A local user can obtain access to the target system.A user with access to the login window can exploit a race condition to gain access without providing a password [CVE-2008-3610]. Systems with the Guest account enabled or another account set up with no password are affected. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected.On systems configured to enforce policies on login passwords, when a user is required to change their password and the password change fails, the current password may not be cleared. A user with access to the login window may be able to change a user's password [CVE-2008-3611]. Version 10.5 and later versions are not affected. Christopher A. Grande of Middlesex Community College reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3611.extra: A local user can access the target system.

CVE-2008-3612.title: Apple iPod touch Generates Predictable TCP Sequence Numbers
CVE-2008-3612.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple iPod touch. A remote user may be able to hijack TCP connections.The system generates sequential TCP initial sequence numbers. A remote user may be able to exploit this to spoof TCP connections or hijack TCP sessions.
CVE-2008-3612.extra: A remote user may be able to spoof or hijack TCP connections.

CVE-2008-3613.title: Mac OS X Finder May Display Incorrect Permissions and Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-3613.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Mac OS X Finder. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Incorrect permissions may be displayed in certain cases.A remote user on the local network user can trigger a null pointer dereference in Finder, causing Finder to exit immediately after starting, making the target system unusable [CVE-2008-3613]. Systems running 10.5.2 are affected. MacBook Air systems running 10.5.3 and 10.5.4 are affected. Yuxuan Wang of Sogou reported this vulnerability.In some cases, the 'Get Info' window may not display the proper privileges for a file [CVE-2008-2331]. Versions prior to 10.5 are not affected. Michel Colman reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3613.extra: A remote user on the local network can cause the target system to become unusuable.The 'Get Info' window may display incorrect permissions in certain cases.

CVE-2008-3614.title: QuickTime PICT/Movie/QTVR/Indeo Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3614.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target application to crash. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2008-3614]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a flaw in the third-party Indeo v5 codec and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3615]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. Paul Byrne of NGSSoftware reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2008-3624]. Roee Hay of IBM Rational Application Security Research Group reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2008-3625]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A movie file with specially crafted STSZ atoms can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3626]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted H.264 encoded movie file can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3627]. An anonymous researcher and Subreption LLC reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an invalid pointer error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3628]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. David Wharton reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read bug and cause the target application to crash [CVE-2008-3629]. Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a stack overflow in the third-party Indeo v3.2 codec [CVE-2008-3635]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2008-3614.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-3614.title: Apple QuickDraw Manager Integer Overflow in Processing PICT Images Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3614.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple QuickDraw Manager. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted PICT image file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-3614.extra: A remote user can create an image file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3615.title: QuickTime PICT/Movie/QTVR/Indeo Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target application to crash. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2008-3614]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a flaw in the third-party Indeo v5 codec and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3615]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. Paul Byrne of NGSSoftware reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2008-3624]. Roee Hay of IBM Rational Application Security Research Group reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2008-3625]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A movie file with specially crafted STSZ atoms can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3626]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted H.264 encoded movie file can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3627]. An anonymous researcher and Subreption LLC reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an invalid pointer error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3628]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. David Wharton reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read bug and cause the target application to crash [CVE-2008-3629]. Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a stack overflow in the third-party Indeo v3.2 codec [CVE-2008-3635]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2008-3615.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-3616.title: Apple SearchKit API Integer Overflows May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-3616.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Apple SearchKit API. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can invoke the API trigger an integer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
CVE-2008-3616.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-3618.title: Mac OS X System Preferences File Sharing Pane Does Not Fully Display the Users Access Privileges
CVE-2008-3618.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X System Preferences. A remote authenticated user can access their home directory even though it is not listed on the File Sharing preferences pane.The File Sharing system preferences screen does not fully convey user access privileges. As a result, a remote authenticated user has greater access than indicated. In addition to directories listed under 'Shared Folders', a remote authenticated user can access their home directory and system administrators can access all disks on the target system.Systems prior to 10.5 are not affected.Mac OS X Server systems are not affected.
CVE-2008-3618.extra: A remote authenticated user can access certain directories that are not indicated in the File Sharing system preferences pane.

CVE-2008-3619.title: Apple Time Machine Discloses Potentially Sensitive Log Files to Local Users
CVE-2008-3619.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Time Machine. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive log files.When a system is backed up with Time Machine, the system saves several log files to the backup drive with permissions that allow users to view the log files.Systems prior to version 10.5 are not affected.Edwin McKenzie reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3619.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive log files.

CVE-2008-3621.title: Mac OS X VideoConference Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3621.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mac OS X VideoConference. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create an H.264 video conference stream that, when joined by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2008-3621.extra: A remote user can create a video conference stream that, when joined by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3622.title: Mac OS X Input Validation Hole in Wiki Server Permits JavaScript Injection Attacks
CVE-2008-3622.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Mac OS X Wiki Server. A remote user can conduct JavaScript injection attacks.The Wiki Server mailing list archive does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can submit a specially crafted e-mail that, when viewed by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Mac OS X Wiki Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Matthias Wieczorek of the Chair for Applied Software Engineering, TU Munich and Leon von Tippelskirch reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3622.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Wiki Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-3623.title: Safari Heap Overflow in CoreGraphics Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3623.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple Safari. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in CoreGraphics in the processing of color spaces and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2008-3623.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-3624.title: QuickTime PICT/Movie/QTVR/Indeo Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code

The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2008-3614]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted H.264 encoded movie file can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3627]. CVE-2008-3624.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target application to crash.

Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a stack overflow in the third-party Indeo v3.2 codec [CVE-2008-3635]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2008-3625.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-3626.title: QuickTime PICT/Movie/QTVR/Indeo Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3626.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target application to crash. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2008-3614]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a flaw in the third-party Indeo v5 codec and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3615]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. Paul Byrne of NGSSoftware reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2008-3624]. Roee Hay of IBM Rational Application Security Research Group reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2008-3625]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A movie file with specially crafted STSZ atoms can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3626]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted H.264 encoded movie file can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3627]. An anonymous researcher and Subreption LLC reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an invalid pointer error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3628]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. David Wharton reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read bug and cause the target application to crash [CVE-2008-3629]. Sergio 'shadown' Alvarez of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a stack overflow in the third-party Indeo v3.2 codec [CVE-2008-3635]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2008-3626.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target application to crash.

CVE-2008-3631.title: Apple iPod touch Lets Local Applications Access Data
CVE-2008-3631.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple iPod touch. A local application can access files of another application.A local application can bypass Application Sandbox restrictions to access potentially sensitive files in a target application's sandbox.Nicolas Seriot of Sen:te and Bryce Cogswell reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3631.extra: A local application can access files of another application.

CVE-2008-3632.title: Apple iPod touch CSS Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3632.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apple iPod touch. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target device.A remote user can create HTML with specially crafted CSS import statements that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target device.
CVE-2008-3632.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target device.

CVE-2008-3634.title: iTunes Provides a Misleading Warning Notice to Users That Enable the iTunes Music Sharing Service Through the Firewall
CVE-2008-3634.body: A vulnerability was reported in iTunes. A local user may be misled about the risks of enabling iTunes Music Sharing through the firewall.When iTunes Music Sharing is blocked by the Mac OS X firewall, the iTunes firewall warning dialog incorrectly indicates to the user that enabling iTunes Music Sharing does not affect the firewall's security.Systems running Mac OS X v10.5 or later are not affected.Eric Hall of DarkArt Consulting Services, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-3634.extra: A local user may be misled about the risks of enabling iTunes Music Sharing through the firewall.

CVE-2008-3635.title: QuickTime PICT/Movie/QTVR/Indeo Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-3635.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in QuickTime. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target application to crash. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an integer overflow [CVE-2008-3614]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A specially crafted movie file can trigger a flaw in the third-party Indeo v5 codec and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3615]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. Paul Byrne of NGSSoftware reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a heap overflow [CVE-2008-3624]. Roee Hay of IBM Rational Application Security Research Group reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted QTVR movie file can trigger a stack overflow [CVE-2008-3625]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A movie file with specially crafted STSZ atoms can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3626]. An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted H.264 encoded movie file can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3627]. An anonymous researcher and Subreption LLC reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an invalid pointer error and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2008-3628]. Only Windows-based systems are affected. David Wharton reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted PICT image can trigger an out-of-bounds memory read bug and cause the target application to crash [CVE-2008-3629].
