CVE-2008-4817.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges.

CVE-2008-4818.title: Adobe Flash Player HTTP Response Header Processing Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-4818.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly process HTTP response headers. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's Flash Player. The code may be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with arbitrary sites, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Adan Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4818.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with arbitrary sites, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-4820.title: Adobe Flash Player ActiveX Control Discloses Information to Remote Users
CVE-2008-4820.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can obtain information from the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke the Flash Player ActiveX control to obtain information from the target user's system.Manuel Caballero reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4820.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain information from the target user's system.

CVE-2008-4821.title: Adobe Flash Player 'jar:' URL Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Information
CVE-2008-4821.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can obtain information from the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted 'jar:' URL that, when loaded by the target user, will disclose information on the target user's system to the remote user.Gregory Fleischer of pseudo-flaw.net reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4821.extra: A remote user can obtain information from the target user's system.

CVE-2008-4822.title: Adobe Flash Player Domain Policy Bug May Let Remote Users Bypass Domain Policy
CVE-2008-4822.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can bypass security policy controls.A remote user can create a specially crafted Flash file that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass non-root domain policy.Alex 'kuza55' K. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4822.extra: A remote user can bypass non-root domain policy controls.

CVE-2008-4823.title: Adobe Flash Player Input Validation Hole Permits HTML Injection Attacks
CVE-2008-4823.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can conduct HTML injection attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted Flash ActionScript attribute that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary HTML code to be executed by the target user's Flash Player.Stefano Di Paola of Minded Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4823.extra: A remote user can conduct HTML injection attacks.

CVE-2008-4825.title: UltraISO Buffer Overflows in Processing CIF, C2D, and GI Files Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-4825.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in UltraISO. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.CIF, C2D, and GI files are affected.The vendor was notified on November 3, 2008.Dyon Balding of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4825.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-4827.title: SAP GUI Heap Overflow in 'sizerone.ocx' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-4827.body: A vulnerability was reported in SAP GUI. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow in the TabOne ActiveX control (sizerone.ocx) and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor was notified on November 13, 2008.Carsten Eiram of Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4827.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-4831.title: Adobe ColdFusion Sandbox Bypass Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-4831.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe ColdFusion. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can bypass sandbox security restrictions to access potentially sensitive information and potentially gain elevated privileges on the target system.The vendor indicates that ColdFusion servers in a shared hosting environment are particularly affected.Jochem van Dieten reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4831.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-4834.title: Windows Server Message Block Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-4834.body: Two vulnerabilities was reported in Windows Server Message Block. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted Server Message Block (SMB) packet to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-4834]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A packet validation flaw also permits remote code execution [CVE-2008-4835].An anonymous reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-4834.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-4835.title: Windows Server Message Block Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-4835.body: Two vulnerabilities was reported in Windows Server Message Block. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted Server Message Block (SMB) packet to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2008-4834]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A packet validation flaw also permits remote code execution [CVE-2008-4835].An anonymous reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-4835.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-4837.title: Microsoft Word Memory Corruption Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-4837.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Word. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Specially crafted Word documents can trigger memory corruption errors [CVE-2008-4024, CVE-2008-4026].Specially crafted Rich Text Format (RTF) documents can trigger parsing errors [CVE-2008-4025, CVE-2008-4027, CVE-2008-4028, CVE-2008-4030, CVE-2008-4031]A specially crafted Word object can trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2008-4837].Ricardo Narvaja of Core Security Technologies, Dyon Balding of Secunia Research, Yamata Li of Palo Alto Networks, Wushi, working with TippingPoint, Aaron Portnoy of TippingPoint DVLabs, and Wushi and Ling, working with TippingPoint, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-4837.extra: A remote user can create a Word or RTF file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-4841.title: Microsoft WordPad Word 97 Text Converter Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-4841.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft WordPad. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Word 97 file that, when opened by the target user with WordPad, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vulnerability resides in the WordPad Text Converter for Word 97 file format.The vendor reports that this vulnerability is being actively exploited.Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista, and Windows Server 2008 are not affected.Microsoft Office Word is not affected.
CVE-2008-4841.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-4844.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer DHTML Data Binding Invalid Pointer Reference Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-4844.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an invalid pointer reference in the DHTML data binding function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Systems with data binding enabled (the default configuration) are affected.The vendor reports that this vulnerability is being actively exploited.
CVE-2008-4844.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-4915.title: VMware CPU Hardware Emulation Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-4915.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware Workstation, Player, ACE, Server, ESX, and ESXi. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest operating system.A local user on a guest operating system can exploit a flaw in the CPU hardware emulation to obtain elevated privileges on the target guest operating system.32-bit and 64-bit guest operating systems are affected.VMware Fusion is not affected.Derek Soeder reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4915.extra: A local user on a guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest operating system system.

CVE-2008-4917.title: VMware ESX Virtual Hardware Memory Access Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-4917.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESX. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user on a guest operating system can send a specially crafted request to the virtual hardware to cause the virtual hardware to write to physical memory on the target system.Andrew Honig of the Department of Defense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4917.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-4917.title: VMware Virtual Hardware Memory Access Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-4917.body: A vulnerability was reported in VMware. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user on a guest operating system can send a specially crafted request to the virtual hardware to cause the virtual hardware to write to physical memory on the target system.Andrew Honig of the Department of Defense reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-4917.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-4992.title: Sun System Firmware Bug Lets Local Users Access Data From Other Logical Domains
CVE-2008-4992.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun System Firmware on certain Sun SPARC Enterprise, Sun Netra, Sun Blade, and Sun Fire systems. A local user can obtain data from other logical domains on the target system.A local privileged user in one logical domain (ldm(1M)) may be able to gain access to memory in another logical domain.Certain systems using the Sun UltraSPARC T1, UltraSPARC T2, and UltraSPARC T2+ processors are affected when running multiple domains.The following systems are affected when running multiple domains: * Sun SPARC Enterprise T5140/T5240 running Sun System Firmware 7.1.3.d or 7.1.3.e * Sun Netra T5220 running Sun System Firmware 7.1.3 * Sun SPARC Enterprise T5120/T5220 running Sun System Firmware 7.1.3.d or 7.1.3.e * Sun Blade T6320 running Sun System Firmware 7.1.3.d or 7.1.3.e * Sun Fire / SPARC Enterprise T2000 running Sun System Firmware 6.6.3, 6.6.4 or 6.6.5 * Sun Fire / SPARC Enterprise T1000 running Sun System Firmware 6.6.3, 6.6.4 or 6.6.5 * Sun Netra T2000 running Sun System Firmware 6.6.3, 6.6.4 or 6.6.5 * Sun Netra CP3060 running Sun System Firmware 6.6.3, 6.6.4 or 6.6.5 * Sun Blade T6300 running Sun System Firmware 6.6.3, 6.6.4 or 6.6.5
CVE-2008-4992.extra: A local privileged user in one logical domain can obtain data from other logical domains on the target system.

CVE-2008-5005.title: UW-IMAP tmail/dmail Folder Name Buffer Overflow Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-5005.body: A vulnerability was reported in UW-IMAP. A local user can gain elevated privileges. A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local user can set a specially crafted folder name extension via the command line to trigger a buffer overflow in the tmail and dmail mail delivery agents to execute arbitrary code. The code will execute with the privileges of the user or with root privileges, depending on the configuration.In some configurations, it may be possible for a remote authenticated user to exploit this flaw.The vendor was notified on October 24, 1008.Aron Andersson and Jan Sahlin of Bitsec reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.bitsec.com/en/rad/bsa-081103.txt
CVE-2008-5005.extra: A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote authenticated user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-5012.title: Mozilla Firefox Canvas Element Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Images
CVE-2008-5012.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can access image content from the target user's browser. A remote user can determine software installed on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML with a specially crafted canvas element that, in conjunction with an HTTP redirect, can access arbitrary images from other domains. Using moz-icon as the redirection target, a remote user can determine software installed on the target user's system.Thunderbird and SeaMonkey are affected.Firefox version 3 is not affected.Georgi Guninski, Michal Zalewski, and Chris Evans reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5012.extra: A remote user can access image content from arbitrary domains on the target user's browser.A remote user can determine software installed on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5013.title: Mozilla Firefox Dynamic Module Unloading Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5013.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted SWF Flash file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a dynamic module unloading flaw to access memory and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Mozilla SeaMonkey is also affected.Firefox version 3 is not affected.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-5013.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5014.title: Mozilla Firefox __proto__ Object Tampering May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5014.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will modify a window.__proto__.__proto__ object to place a lock on a non-native object and crash the target user's browser. It may be possible to execute arbitrary code on the target system. However, code execution was not confirmed in the report.SeaMonkey and Thunderbird are also affected.Jesse Ruderman reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5014.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the target user's browser to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-5015.title: Mozilla Firefox 'file:' URLs Let Users Gain Chrome Privileges
CVE-2008-5015.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.When a user opens a 'file:' URL in the same tab as a chrome page or privileged 'about:' page, the file will run with chrome privileges.Firefox version 2 is not affected.Luke Bryan reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5015.extra: A user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-5016.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in Browser Engine Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5016.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger memory corruption errors in the browser engine and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.SeaMonkey and Thunderbird are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, Daniel Veditz, Bob Clary, and Joachim Kuebart reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-5016.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5017.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in Browser Engine Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5017.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger memory corruption errors in the browser engine and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.SeaMonkey and Thunderbird are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, Daniel Veditz, Bob Clary, and Joachim Kuebart reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-5017.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5018.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in Browser Engine Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5018.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger memory corruption errors in the browser engine and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.SeaMonkey and Thunderbird are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, Daniel Veditz, Bob Clary, and Joachim Kuebart reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-5018.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5019.title: Mozilla Firefox Session Restore Same-Origin Policy Flaw Permits Cross-Domain Scripting and Privilege Escalation Attacks
CVE-2008-5019.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks to gain privileges on the target user's system.The session restore feature does not properly enforce same-origin policy. A remote user cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser in the context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Arbitrary scripting code can also be executed with chrome privileges.David Bloom and moz_bug_r_a4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5019.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with arbitrary sites, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can gain chrome privileges on the target user's browser.

CVE-2008-5021.title: Mozilla Firefox nsFrameManager Memory Access Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5021.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will modify certain properties of a file input element before the element is initialized to access uninitialized memory and potentially execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.SeaMonkey and Thunderbird are also affected.ling and wushi of team509 reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint.
CVE-2008-5021.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5022.title: Mozilla Firefox nsXMLHttpRequest::NotifyEventListeners() Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Same-Origin Policies
CVE-2008-5022.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of arbitrary domains.A remote user can create HTML to bypass same-origin policy checks in nsXMLHttpRequest::NotifyEventListeners() to execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of arbitrary domains.Thunderbird and SeaMonkey are affected.moz_bug_r_a4 reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5022.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of arbitrary domains.

CVE-2008-5023.title: Mozilla Firefox -moz-binding CSS Property Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Checks
CVE-2008-5023.body: A vulnerability was reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can bypass codebase principal security checks.A remote user can replace a stylesheet in a signed JAR that uses relative paths and then invoke the -moz-binding property to inject arbitrary scripting code into the JAR file. The code can then be executed with the privileges of the signed JAR (in the security context of arbitrary sites).SeaMonkey is also affected.Collin Jackson reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5023.extra: A remote user can bypass codebase principal security checks to execute arbitrary scripting code in the context of an arbitrary site.

CVE-2008-5025.title: Linux Kernel Buffer Overflow in hfs_cat_find_brec() Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-5025.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can create a specially crafted HFS filesystem catalog name to trigger a buffer overflow in hfs_cat_find_brec() and corrupt the stack.
CVE-2008-5025.extra: A local user can cause the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-5027.title: HP Insight Control suite for Linux Bugs in Nagios Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Bypass Authentication
CVE-2008-5027.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP Insight Control suite for Linux (ICE-LX). A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote authenticated user can bypass certain security restrictions.Several vulnerabilities exist in Nagios, which is included in HP's ICE-LX.
CVE-2008-5027.extra: A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote authenticated user can bypass certain security restrictions.

CVE-2008-5028.title: HP Insight Control suite for Linux Bugs in Nagios Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Bypass Authentication
CVE-2008-5028.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in HP Insight Control suite for Linux (ICE-LX). A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote authenticated user can bypass certain security restrictions.Several vulnerabilities exist in Nagios, which is included in HP's ICE-LX.
CVE-2008-5028.extra: A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote authenticated user can bypass certain security restrictions.

CVE-2008-5038.title: Novell eDirectory NCP Request Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5038.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell eDirectory. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a series of specially crafted 'Get NCP Extension Information By Name' requests to trigger a memory corruption error in the NetWare Core Protocol (NCP) implementation and execute arbitrary code.The vendor was notified on March 10, 2008.An anonymous researcher reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2008-5038.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-5050.title: Clam AntiVirus Buffer Overflow in get_unicode_name() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5050.body: A vulnerability was reported in Clam AntiVirus. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted VBA project file attachment to trigger a heap overflow in the get_unicode_name() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target clamd service. The vulnerability resides in 'libclamav/vba_extract.c'.The vendor was notified on October 16, 2008.Moritz Jodeit reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5050.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-5052.title: Mozilla Firefox Bugs in Browser Engine Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5052.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Mozilla Firefox. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger memory corruption errors in the browser engine and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.SeaMonkey and Thunderbird are also affected.Jesse Ruderman, Martijn Wargers, Daniel Veditz, Bob Clary, and Joachim Kuebart reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-5052.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5077.title: OpenSSL Signature Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Validation Checks
CVE-2008-5077.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can bypass digital signature validation.The software does not properly check the results of the EVP_VerifyFinal() function. As a result, a remote server can supply a specially crafted invalid signature on a certificate that will be detected as a valid certificate. Signature checks on DSA and ECDSA keys used with SSL/TLS are affected.Clients that connect to servers using RSA keys are not affected.Client certificate validation is not affected.The Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5077.extra: A remote user can bypass certificate validation.

CVE-2008-5078.title: GNU Enscript Buffer Overflows in Processing Special Escape Sequences Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5078.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU Enscript. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted ASCII file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Files opened with the "special escapes" option (-e or --escapes) enabled are affected.The read_special_escape() function in 'src/psgen.c' is affected when processing the 'setfilename' sequence [CVE-2008-3863]. Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.The read_special_escape() function in 'src/psgen.c' is affected when processing the 'font' sequence [CVE-2008-4306]. Secunia Research reported this vulnerability.The recognize_eps_file() function in 'src/psgen.c' and the tilde_subst() function in 'src/util.c' are affected when processing a file name [CVE-2008-5078].
CVE-2008-5078.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5079.title: Linux Kernel svc_listen() Bug Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-5079.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Linux Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can invoke the svc_listen() function more than once on the same socket and then read /proc/net/atm/*vc to cause the kernel to enter an infinite loop.The vulnerability resides in 'net/atm/svc.c'.The vendor was notified on November 28, 2008.Hugo Dias reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5079.extra: A local user can cause the kernel to enter an infinite loop.

CVE-2008-5091.title: Novell eDirectory Buffer Overflow in LDAP Service Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5091.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell eDirectory in the LDAP service. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted LDAP data to trigger a buffer overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.
CVE-2008-5091.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-5092.title: Novell eDirectory Heap Overflows in HTTP Protocol Stack Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5092.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell eDirectory in the HTTP protocol stack (HTTPSTK). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP header values to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.A specially crafted HTTP language header and a specially crafted HTTP content-length header can trigger an overflow.
CVE-2008-5092.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-5093.title: Novell eDirectory Input Validation Hole in HTTPSTK Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-5093.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell eDirectory in the HTTP protocol stack (HTTPSTK). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The HTTP protocol stack does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Novell eDirectory software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2008-5093.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Novell eDirectory software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-5094.title: Novell eDirectory Heap Overflow in NDS Service May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5094.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell eDirectory in the NDS service. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted NDS protocol data to trigger a heap overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.On Windows-based systems, a remote user can send specially crafted NDS protocol data to trigger a memory corruption error to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-5094.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2008-5095.title: Novell User Application Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-5095.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell User Application. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Novell User Application software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2008-5095.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Novell User Application software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-5095.title: Novell Identity Manager Input Validation Hole in Roles Based Provisioning Module Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-5095.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell Identity Manager Roles Based Provisioning Module. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Novell Identity Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2008-5095.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Novell Identity Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-5098.title: Sun Java System Messaging Server Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-5098.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Java System Messaging Server. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Sun Java System Messaging Server software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Seth Hall of Ohio State University reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5098.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Sun Java System Messaging Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-5099.title: Sun Logical Domains Password Disclosure Bug Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-5099.body: A vulnerability was reported in Sun Logical Domains (LDoms). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The Logical Domain Manager (ldm(1M)) displays the OpenBoot PROM firmware security password in clear text for primary and guest domains. A local user can invoke the manager (ldm ls -l) to obtain the SPARC firmware password and gain elevated privileges on the target system.
CVE-2008-5099.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-5108.title: Adobe AIR Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Javascript With Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-5108.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe AIR. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed on the target user's system with elevated privileges.A remote user can create specially crafted data that, when loaded by the target Adobe AIR application, will execute arbitrary scripting code with elevated privileges on the target system.Chris Weber of Casaba Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5108.extra: A remote user can create data that, when loaded by the target user's AIR application, will execute arbitrary scripting code with elevated privileges on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5114.title: Sun Java System Identity Manager Bugs Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks and Disclose Files to Remote Users
CVE-2008-5114.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Sun Java System Identity Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A local or remote user can view certain files on the target system.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Sun Java System Identity Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can also redirect the target user to arbitrary sites.A remote user can also conduct cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks to cause the target user's browser to perform administrative functions.A remote or local user can exploit an unspecified flaw to access certain files on the target Identity Manager server's filesystem.Richard Brain, Adrian Pastor, and Jan Fry of ProCheckup Ltd. reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-5114.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Sun Java System Identity Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can view certain files on the target system.

CVE-2008-5124.title: Secure FTP Applet Does Not Verify SSH Server Host Keys
CVE-2008-5124.body: A vulnerability was reported in Secure FTP Applet. A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.The software does not verify the host key when the target user connects to the target server. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to monitor the connection between the target user and target server.The vendor was notified on April 12, 2006.Frank Dick and Thierry Zoller of n.runs AG reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5124.extra: A remote user can conduct man-in-the-middle attacks to monitor the connection.

CVE-2008-5161.title: OpenSSH CBC Mode Error Handling May Let Certain Remote Users Obtain Plain Text in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-5161.body: A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.A remote user with control of the network between the client and the server can inject connection errors and monitor the SSH error handling response to recover up to 32 bits of plain text from an SSH-protected connection.The attack process will terminate the SSH connection.CBC mode connections are affected.CTR mode connections are not affected.Martin Albrecht, Kenny Paterson and Gaven Watson from the Information Security Group at Royal Holloway, University of London reported this vulnerability via the Centre for the Protection of National Infrastructure (CPNI).The original advisory is available at:http://www.cpni.gov.uk/Docs/Vulnerability_Advisory_SSH.txt
CVE-2008-5161.extra: A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.

CVE-2008-5161.title: SSH Tectia CBC Mode Error Handling May Let Certain Remote Users Obtain Plain Text in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-5161.body: A vulnerability was reported in SSH Tectia. A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.A remote user with control of the network between the client and the server can inject connection errors and monitor the SSH error handling response to recover up to 32 bits of plain text from an SSH-protected connection.The attack process will terminate the SSH connection.CBC mode connections are affected.CTR mode connections are not affected.Martin Albrecht, Kenny Paterson, and Gaven Watson from the Information Security Group at Royal Holloway, University of London reported this vulnerability via the Centre for the Protection of National Infrastructure (CPNI).The original advisory is available at:http://www.cpni.gov.uk/Docs/Vulnerability_Advisory_SSH.txt
CVE-2008-5161.extra: A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.

CVE-2008-5161.title: Solaris Secure Shell CBC Mode Error Handling May Let Certain Remote Users Obtain Plain Text in Certain Cases
CVE-2008-5161.body: A vulnerability was reported in Solaris Secure Shell (SSH). A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.A remote user with control of the network between the client and the server can inject connection errors and monitor the SSH error handling response to recover up to 32 bits of plain text from an SSH-protected connection.The attack process will terminate the SSH connection.CBC mode connections are affected.CTR mode connections are not affected.Martin Albrecht, Kenny Paterson and Gaven Watson from the Information Security Group at Royal Holloway, University of London reported this vulnerability via the Centre for the Protection of National Infrastructure (CPNI).The original advisory is available at:http://www.cpni.gov.uk/Docs/Vulnerability_Advisory_SSH.txt
CVE-2008-5161.extra: A remote user with control of the network can obtain portions of plain text in certain cases.

CVE-2008-5162.title: FreeBSD arc4random(9) Generates Predictable Sequences
CVE-2008-5162.body: A vulnerability was reported in FreeBSD's arc4random(9) random number generator. The system may generate predictable sequences.When the arc4random(9) random number generator is initialized, there may be inadequate entropy for up to 5 minutes before arc4random(9) is reseeded with secure entropy from the Yarrow random number generator.Functions that use arc4random(9) for random sequences may be less secure than intended.The GEOM ELI providers with onetime keys and GEOM shsec providers are affected. WEP encryption and authentication is affected. The IPv4, IPv6 and TCP/UDP protocol implementations are affected. The RPC code is afffected.Robert Woolley, Mark Murray, Maxim Dounin, and Ruslan Ermilov reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5162.extra: The system may generate predictable sequences.

CVE-2008-5165.title: eTicket Input Validation Flaw in 'pri' Parameter Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2008-5165.body: A vulnerability was reported in eTicket. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The software does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'pri' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The 'index.php', 'open.php', 'open_raw.php', and 'newticket.php' pages are affected.The original advisory is available at:http://www.digitrustgroup.com/advisories/web-application-security-eticket2.htmlOmer Singer of the DigiTrust Group reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5165.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2008-5180.title: Microsoft Office Communicator VoIP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-5180.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office Communicator. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted instant messages that contain a large number of emoticons to cause the target user's Microsoft Communicator to become temporarily unresponsive and fail to respond to incoming invite messages. The target phone may be required to re-register.A remote user can send a specially crafted RTCP receiver report packet to cause denial of service conditions. Microsoft Communicator, Office Communications Server (OCS), and Windows Live Messenger are affected.A remote user can cause the target user's Microsoft Communicator to open a large number of sessions, consuming excessive memory on the target user's system.The original advisories are available at:http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=131http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=132http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=133VoIPshield Systems reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-5180.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2008-5181.title: Microsoft Office Communicator VoIP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-5181.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office Communicator. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted instant messages that contain a large number of emoticons to cause the target user's Microsoft Communicator to become temporarily unresponsive and fail to respond to incoming invite messages. The target phone may be required to re-register.A remote user can send a specially crafted RTCP receiver report packet to cause denial of service conditions. Microsoft Communicator, Office Communications Server (OCS), and Windows Live Messenger are affected.A remote user can cause the target user's Microsoft Communicator to open a large number of sessions, consuming excessive memory on the target user's system.The original advisories are available at:http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=131http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=132http://www.voipshield.com/research-details.php?id=133VoIPshield Systems reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-5181.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2008-5183.title: CUPS RSS Subscription Null Pointer Dereference Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2008-5183.body: A vulnerability was reported in CUPS. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can submit a large number of printing jobs that require mail notification on completion to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause cupsd to crash.pdp reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://www.gnucitizen.org/blog/pwning-ubuntu-via-cups/
CVE-2008-5183.extra: A local user can cause the cupsd daemon on the target system to crash.

CVE-2008-5225.title: Xerox DocuShare Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2008-5225.body: A vulnerability was reported in DocuShare. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the DocuShare software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:http://[target]/dsdn/dsweb/SearchResults/XSShttp://[target]/dsdn/dsweb/Services/User-XSShttp://[target]/docushare/dsweb/ServicesLib/Group-#/XSS
CVE-2008-5225.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the DocuShare software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2008-5229.title: Windows Vista Buffer Overflow in CreateIpForwardEntry2() May Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2008-5229.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Vista. Certain local users may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user with Network Configuration Operators group privileges of Administrators group privileges can trigger a buffer overflow in the TCP/IP stack to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.A specially crafted DestinationPrefix PrefixLength value in the CreateIpForwardEntry2 method can trigger the overflow.The vendor was notified on October 22, 2008.Marius Wachtler, Michael Burgbacher, Carson Hounshell, Michael Craggs, and Thomas Unterleitner at phion AG reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2008-5229.extra: A local user with certain privileges may be able to obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2008-5232.title: Windows Media Services ActiveX Control Buffer Overflow in CallHTMLHelp() Function Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5232.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Media Services. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke a Windows Media Services ActiveX control and trigger a buffer overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted call to CallHTMLHelp() can trigger the overflow in 'nskey.dll'.The CLSID of the vulnerable control is: 2646205B-878C-11D1-B07C-0000C040BCDBJeremy Brown reported this vulnerability.The original advisory is available at:http://packetstormsecurity.org/0808-exploits/wms-overflow.txt
CVE-2008-5232.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2008-5233.title: xine-lib Bugs in Processing Media Files Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5233.body: A vulnerability was reported in xine-lib. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a file with a specially crafted ID3 value that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Real file may also be able to trigger a buffer overflow in the Real demuxer.A remote user can create specially crafted media files (e.g., Ogg format) that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a crash [CVE-2008-3231].
CVE-2008-5233.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target player to crash.

CVE-2008-5234.title: xine-lib Bugs in Processing Media Files Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2008-5234.body: A vulnerability was reported in xine-lib. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a file with a specially crafted ID3 value that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Real file may also be able to trigger a buffer overflow in the Real demuxer.A remote user can create specially crafted media files (e.g., Ogg format) that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a crash [CVE-2008-3231].
CVE-2008-5234.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target player to crash.

CVE-2008-5235.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system or cause the target player to crash.

CVE-2008-5245.body: A vulnerability was reported in xine-lib. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted Real file may also be able to trigger a buffer overflow in the Real demuxer.A remote user can create specially crafted media files (e.g., Ogg format) that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a crash [CVE-2008-3231].
